review: Lexapro (escitalopram):Okay, It kinda worked 50/50. At first lifted my depression (but I got hypomania). Major anxiety at first. It helped with dissociation tho. I couldn't sleep at night and I was sleepy during the day. I also had an episode of like half(?) depression. I am not saying I don't recommend it, actually I do, because it has changed *something*. I JUST WASN'T DEPRESSED, IT WAS BIPOLAR, so that's a pity. I didn't have any serious physical side effects. (10 mg)

Lexapro (escitalopram):I started taking Escitalopram about 3 years ago to address anxiety and depression. For the first week, I started at 5 mg and then 10 mg and experienced a panic attack and some increased anxiety, excessive yawning and nausea. These side effects disappeared within a few weeks. I am now taking 20 mg and find that this is the most effective dose for me. The medication helps me to feel more motivated, my brain feels calmer and I am more easily able to counter negative thoughts rather than dwelling on them, I have more energy and my mood feels more stable with less ups and downs especially around my menstrual cycle. I also feel less anxious in social situations and previous situations where I would feel anxiety, such as before making a presentation at work. Overall, this medication works really well for me and I’m satisfied.

It worked good to balance out my mood. I could finally function again. I have depression and GAD. What I really dislike is that I gained 30 pounds within a matter of months so now my self esteem is low. I didn't have any other side effects.

Lexapro (escitalopram):After resisting for so long, I took my first 5mg Lexapro last night at night. Shaking as I took it but I needed to stop the depression and anxiety. Took it at 8pm, because the other time I took it was in the AM and fought drowsiness. Slept great. But the drowsiness hit me at 8am. Still drowsy but trying to push through it so I can enjoy the day. The comments have been great and help as I start this journey.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I was taking 10 mg for 2 months, after 5 weeks on that dosage I felt depressed & weepy & suicidal.  Consulted my Dr who increased dosage to 20 mg daily after a few days felt happy again , but after 4 weeks started feeling sad again

Lexapro (escitalopram):This medication literally traumatized me... my first antidepressant after being absolutely terrified to try medications and it was the worst experience of my life. I almost ended up in the hospital for suicidal thoughts, worse than ever before. Obviously all medications work different for everyone and all are worth a try, but be careful with this one.
Lexapro (escitalopram):Amazing drug I felt like it really helps me just live life finally, after trying many other drugs. I highly recommend if you having social anxiety or depression

An Update. I have been on Escitalopram 10mg since this past July. A few weeks ago, I started to feel flat or moody, not social, no motivation. Depression increased. I figured it was the winter months since nothing had changed in my life. 10 days ago, I decided to increase to 15mg and changed it to taking it at noon instead of bedtime. (I take other meds at bedtime and figured maybe those meds decrease the effectiveness). I was also concerned that maybe my body got use to the med and it just wouldn't work as well and I would have to switch SSRIs. BUT I have to say that it really did help! I am more cheerful and happy and social again. I am just moody ever so often, but I guess that's just me XD I relied a lot on cannabis to pick up my mood, but haven't touched the stuff since the increase. Just didn't feel like I needed it. As far as side effects go, my ankle cramps came back and needing a nap in the evenings. But I see this as temporary. I will try to go back to 10mg in summer. See how it goes.

I am going to share the experience I am witnessing with my daughter (21) and  I am hoping for feedback from people that have successfully used Lexapro.   My daughter started on 10mg and did pretty well.  She experienced a panic attack while taking it, and talked to her dr about it.  The dr raised her to 20 mg and she has been on it for 3 days.   She can hardly get herself to do anything.  She is so tired and seems so depressed.  I don’t know if she just needs more time to adjust to 20mg, or if it’s too much? What have you found?

I have been taking escitalopram for about a year now. I am 20, and this is the first anti depressant I have taken. This past year has been the most stable and happy I have ever been. I no longer spiral and cry everyday, and I feel so much more inspired and productive. I use to feel very intense waves of sadness and depression, and no amount of CBT and positive thinking could help lol. I take 10 mg every night before bed. Since starting it I have had no side effects. I wish I would have been prescribed it a lot earlier in my life. I also have general anxiety, social anxiety and a bit of ocd and I think it has helped with all of those as well. This medication has made such a positive difference in my life, I never want to go off of it.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I've been on Lexapro for about 6 months now for depression and I cannot express how much I love this medication: my depression symptoms have decreased by about 90%! Yes I did have some side effects: increased anxiety, agitation and strange mood swings but be patient, these do eventually go away. It took about 8 weeks for it to work and during that time I did think about quitting, so I strongly urge anyone in their first 8 weeks experiencing side effects to hold it out because it's worth it in the end. I was originally on 10mg but I've increased to 15mg as I was feeling less depressed but unenthusiastic on 10. The extra 5mg has given me more energy and positive emotion.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I got on Lexapro shortly after the birth of my daughter. I recently quit taking it after 3.5 years. Lexapro helped me to come out of my depressed state, somewhat. I no longer felt sad, but at the same time, I did NOT feel joyful. I increased my dosage to 20 Mg and still didn't feel a difference. I also felt like it numbed my feelings. In those 3.5 years, I cried only once. During major life events (like losing a loved one) I felt nothing. The two reasons I decided to stop this medication were because it didn't help to achieve a more "happy" state and I gained 20lbs. I started this medication weighing 120 and am now at 140. Healthy eating habits and exercise have always been part of my routine so the weight gain could not be attributed to a sloppy lifestyle. I could no longer deal with the weight gain. The weight SLOWLY came. 5lbs at first was not that big of a deal, but when I could no longer fit into my clothes I'd had enough.

After struggling with depression and anxiety it was the best I've ever been so I absolutely loved escitalopram and thought I had no side effects. It made me semi-functional which made it look like it works and it's great but it's not. It severely damaged the quality of my life for the last 5 years and it took me a while to understand that.There is not a single person who will not experience side effects. The most destabilizing are fatigue, excessive sleeping, brain fog, indifference, restrained range and intensity of emotion (I barely had any), decreased sexual sensitivity (delayed ejaculation), weight gain. It's absolutely not a fix and I don't know why such a damaging drug has become so popular. If I could give myself advice years ago I would say don't take it. Research other drugs and stay away from SSRIs. Quitting after long-term use can damage you and leave you with withdrawal symptoms for months and in some cases permanently. I am tapering over 9-12 months.
Lexapro (escitalopram):Took 5 weeks of awful side effects before it kicked in. But when it did, it was a marvel. Thankyou.

Lexapro (escitalopram):When I first took Lexapro I had a headache and Diarrhea,  that was when I was on 5mg. When they put me on 10mg everything get better with my depression and anxiety and this was after a week

I am a teenager, have been on escitalopram for over 2 months. I started at 5mg, upped to 10mg when I had no (noticeable) side effects. Shortly after being upped to 10mg I felt like a shell of myself. My personality feels different - more hollow, I do more stupid things when interacting with people and I don't feel as much anymore. For the first time in my life, I can say that I've had no suicidal thoughts beyond extremely passive 'kill yourself' '...no' exchanges in my brain. It's helped a lot with my anxiety (working on a GAD diagnosis), but I still have no motivation for anything. I guess I'm more sociable, but more awkward and less... organic? I had a breakdown a few weeks ago about how this medication makes me feel less like me, but I'm still taking it because I don't want to worry my family. TLDR: it does what it's supposed to, I just don't like how it changes my personality and makes me disassociate from myself.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I really regret taking this. I went on a low dose of it for anxiety, and the side effects at the beginning were tremendous. It was like having the stomach flu for weeks, and I was so sleepy and tired and foggy. But eventually, it worked. I felt happy again and the anxiety was manageable. However, it slowly seemed to lose effect over the months, and I was back to being irritable, but with a side of tired (which is kind of extreme because I'm on Wellbutrin, which has a stimulating effect). I couldn't take being tired all the time, so I weaned slowly off of it but still had discontinuation syndrome. It was a nightmare. After weeks of weaning, I slowly began to feel physically normal, but it's like my brain can't remember how to make serotonin anymore. I'm not a crier, but I cry all day everyday. I'm so miserable but I'm afraid of going back on any SSRI after this, it feels like a trap. I've never experienced this with Wellbutrin, citalopram, or Prozac. I wish I'd never taken this.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I started lexapro in summer of 2020 after dealing with horrible depression and anxiety. I had previously tried Wellbutrin and it made me feel absolutely horrible. As a last resort my doctor prescribed lexapro, I started at 5mg for the first week and then went up to 10mg which I stayed at for just over a year. It helped my depression and anxiety more than I can describe, and I don’t remember suffering from any awful side effects. I may have gained a little weight, but I was also taking another medication so I’m not sure which it was. Anyways, lexapro gave me my life back without debilitating anxiety and depression. It’s worth a try if you’re struggling. I have since weaned down to 5mg with no side effects, and I plan to discontinue the medication at my next check up in three months as I am in a good place mentally now. I hope this review helps someone who may be hesitant about trying it. I know how hard it is to be struggling and scared to try a new medication.

I was on 20 mg Lexapro for the past 6 years, and starting tapering off in September to transition to just being on Wellbutrin and buspirone. I barely remember the last six years of my life and the withdrawal process has been absolutely terrible. I’ve read that for some people they don’t feel normal for over a year after they stop taking the drug. For the past two months I have been crying at everything, experiencing insane anger that I’ve never felt before, and generally feel like I’m not really here. I couldn’t cry when I was on lexapro which was really frustrating sometimes but now I can’t stop!! Hoping some day I will be at peace. 5 because at least I am alive

During the Covid situation I have used Cipralex 10mg the first time due to panic attacks and anxiety. I have never dealt with stuff like this before (was 22 years old at this time)After 6 months I felt really happy and decided to go off it. After 3 months I felt into a deep depression, with dark thoughts, anxiety about the future. This time the beginning with this drug was really hard, I felt miserable, didn't know what I should do. But after 2 weeks I can slowly live a "normal" life, can sleep, work, be creative and so on... It isn't magic but it helps you to get your life back step by step.If you are struggling, please trust the process, it definitely pays off. side effects: weird dreams, sometimes I feel a bit dizzy, pay attention on your weight if you use it :)(sorry for any mistakes, I am no native speaker)

So I thought I would give an update.  I started escitalopram in mid-August 2021.  I was on Paxil for over 20 years and it stopped working.  So I tapered off Paxil and started escitalopram at 5mg for 1 week.  Then went to 10mg for about 3 weeks.  Then my Dr. upped my dose to 15mg.  Its been over 7 weeks on 15mg and I feel better.  The anxiety reduced fairly quickly but the depress mood takes longer.  I'm not back to 100% but feel better.  I had side effects like insomnia, headache, brain fog and nausea.  Those went away after a few weeks.  Brain fog took longer.  I find escitalopram works very slowly.  You have to be patient.  But I am feeling a lot better now than I did in August.  Be patient.  I know its hard but stick with it.  Some people get quick relief.  It took me longer and I'm still improving every day.  You will get bad days but those will pass.  I take Cipralex which is the brand name for Lexapro here in Canada.  I do not take the generic.

I just took this for the first time right now. I came to internet to see what the side effects would be and found this page. I hope that my experience mirrors some of the ones that I’m reading. If I can just get my mind to slow from racing I think it would be better. Suffered my first panic attack last week. Here’s to hoping I’m better in 1 to 2 weeks!

Lexapro (escitalopram):I have had MDD for 23 years.  Originally put on Zoloft and it worked well for several years.  After noticing decreased effectiveness was switched to Effexor but had bad side effects from missing one dose.  So switched to Trintillex which did not help me.  I now have been on lexapro 10mg and Wellbutrin 150mg for 1 month and am doing much better  I was afraid to start Lexapro related to listed side effects.  I haven't experienced ANY side effects.   My doctor was a little surprised but I did well on Zoloft and they are closely related.  A game changer for me.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I have struggled with anxiety and depression as long as I can remember. My family doctor would never prescribe me anything because I was like 14 when I first came to him with my concerns. Fast forward to 24 and I have my first child. My depression and anxiety worsened exponentially. I was crying all day, each day felt like years, it was such a dark time. The second my OB saw me for a follow up I was sobbing to her. She prescribed me 10mg and told me to give it a few weeks. When I tell you I noticed a difference in DAYS. Obviously not the case for most, but this med was exactly what my brain needed. I still feel all the emotions, they just don’t overwhelm me. I can take care of myself and my child with ease. It saved my life truly.

I started leprexo 4 months ago. 2 weeks on 5mg then 3 weeks on 10mg started feeling worse again so doctor upped me to 15mg and again 3 weeks later felt worse again so upped to 20mg. Been on 20mg now for 6 weeks and although my anxiety and depression is better I think I might of gone up to 20mg too quick . I should have stayed on 10mg for at least 6 weeks then decided.  Only I feel 20mg is too strong I got this weird feeling on and off all day. But I am trying to hold on for another few more weeks to see if it'll settle before I go back down to 15mg and stay on that for a bit to see if it better
It takes about 2 month for depression to improve, its' give my life back !

I took Lexapro before (20MG) and I was feeling flat. No emotion whatsoever. That was worse than the depression and anxiety. So I went off it. Then I tried Remeron, and gained 20 pounds despite 90 minutes of exercise a day. So I started weaning off the Remeron and added back in only 5 MG of Lexapro. Within a week I was feeling so much better. The anxiety was lifted so I slept better. I didn't have the flat affect either. It was like a light went on so I went up to 10MG of Lexapro because I thought, more is better. Boy was I wrong. The lethargy, constant yawning, and extreme tiredness, despite a good nights sleep was awful. Enter in depression again when I went swimming, which I love, but was unable to motivate myself to even swim a lap. Now I am going back to 5MG which is considered "low dose", but I don't care. Everyone is different and 10 MG was too much for me. Listen to your body, it will not lie to you, no matter what the doctors say. Hopefully I will return to the light at 5 MG.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I’m damned if I do, and damned if I don’t. Been on lexamil for 6 months, tried to go off it but the side effects were too severe. I realised how much anxiety and depression had taken a toll on me prior to medication, because when the symptoms came back after lexamil I fell apart.It’s not an easy decision, but I’m cutting my losses for now and just going to continue to take the medication. Feel okay on it, it’s just loss of euphoric emotions / creativity / sex drive that I miss.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Started taking Lexapro 10mg two days ago (10/9/21) Currently undergoing several health issues, so asked Doc to prescribe something to keep me positive. Currently 10/10/21Overall Happiness: Level 1.5/10Feel anxious, thinking of health issues, fatigued, loss of appetite, bed most of day.Will Update.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I've been on quite a few medications in the past for depression & anxiety. I've been on Zoloft, Paxil, Prozac, & Celexa. Celexa is in the same medicine family as Lexapro, but is milder. I maxed out the highest dosage on Celexa for awhile, & was still feeling pretty bad, and stressed out about different situations going on in my personal life. Lexapro has been the medicine that works for me. I found that Lexapro (Escitolapram Oxalate) had made me feel a little weird at first, for a few weeks, like tired and drowsy. I figured out to take my pill at bedtime since it made me tired. By the 3rd-4th week, I was feeling like a new person. I felt happier, like I wanted to do the things that I used to avoid, even more. Lexapro actually helps me sleep, & wakes me up too, after 7-8 hrs. of sleep. I feel that it has been a great fit for me. I've been on Lexapro for 6 1/2 yrs. now. It has helped out my anxiety & depression dramatically.

I have been on cipralex for 6 and a half years. I originally was on 10mg, which didn't seem like enough so we went to 20mg. It took maybe 3-4 weeks until it started working fully. There were some side effects at the beginning, but they were all minor (dry mouth, sweaty palms). It got me out of a dark place - I couldn't sleep, could barely eat, was on edge (either with depression on anxiety 24/7. I could barely function. Since then, I got my life back. However, I have had 3 relapses since then - two in the winter, around a month each and one during the summer over the pandemic on and off for about 3 months - and experienced emotional blunting. So I am 'ok' most days, but haven't experienced real happiness in a long time. Stay strong all of you and I wish everyone the best in their path to recovery!!

I was prescribed 5mg of lexapro to deal with slight depression and anxiety from my fathers death and lots of major changes in my life over the past year. Within 30 minutes of taking my first dose I was incredibly tired and couldn’t keep my eyes open. I fell asleep that night and woke up with extreme anxiety, I took my second dose thinking it would help, I stayed anxious the whole day. The next day I took it at night to see if that helped. 30 minutes later I started having extreme anxiety and hot flashes. I had a panic attack and was not able to calm myself the entire night. I did not sleep, and when I did fall asleep eventually it was only for 30 minutes because of pure exhaustion from panicking all night. I woke up in a panic attack and stayed that way all day, stopped taking it and went to see my doctor the next day. It gave me mild serotonin syndrome, and I’m still coming down from it 3 days after stopping.

After taking the drug for few weeks in small doses 5mg My bowel movements are much betterDoesn't need a "rest" after, I can sit right after Its not hurting or burning there Depression and anxiety disappeared after starting taking and going to bathroom each day .Middle of the day naps are amazing sometimes it feels better then the night Side effect, I had some side effects when I had some beers It was awful, really avoid any of those drinks!! Other then that can't say I had any side effectsIts really game changer drug. Can make you go and enjoy life from bad place.  I'm recommending

So after being on Paxil for 20+ years it just didn’t seem to work anymore. So my GP and I agreed to try Cipralex (escitalopram). For the first 2 weeks I crossed tapered between Paxil and escitalopram.  My GP gave 10mg for 2 weeks and then wanted me to go to 20mg. But after talking to him we agreed that I would stay on 10mg for at least 6 weeks to see if it will work. Escitalopram can take 6 to 8 weeks to « kick in ». So this is week 4 on 10mg and I can feel it start working. Anxiety is gone for the most part and mood is improving. After reading reviews here I realized it take time for escitalopram to take full effect. I was also diagnosed as pre diabetic while I was on Paxil and prescribed diabetes medication. Since I switched to escitalopram my sugar levels have gone down 20%. Now I have to adjust my diabetes medication. Is this the result of the switch?  I don’t know. I’m not a doctor and this is just my observation.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Life changing! I tried several other medications and had terrible side effects. I’ve been on Lexapro for about 2 years now (with a break in between) and it has been amazing. I suffer from anxiety/depression due to Narcolepsy. My advice is to tapper slowlyyyyy up to your dose. This will avoid the nausea while your body gets used to it. I’ve had no negative side effects, only relief. Do not stop suddenly or you will get withdrawals!

Hi There,I’ve been taking Escitalopram 15MG for 3 weeks and although it’s helped my depression and anxiety, my insomnia is now ten times worse. Strong sleep aids aren’t helping. Has anyone found this who suffers with Insomnia. It’s so frustrating - ever since this medication started to work my insomnia has become even more chronic. The doctors don’t want to prescribe more sleeping meds, so I’ve made the decision to cut back to 5MG and with the hope to stop it completely in a week. Any suggestions I would appreciate. Oh, and my doctor is off until next Friday.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I am looking up now after reading everyone's comments, I am on week 2 and I don't really feel better, I feel a lot of cloudiness in my mind and my anxiety is still the same as before. I am also having a little bit of a fluttery heart from time to time. I am grateful for finding the comments, it makes me hopeful.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I was diagnosed with depression and anxiety a while back. I felt as if I had no purpose in life and all there was for me was suffering. I could feel little to no lasting joying in things and I felt like a shell. I contacted a psychiatrist and I was put on a starting dose of 5mg and wow, it started to make all the difference in weeks. I am now on 10mg and I am starting to feel like myself again. I have far more energy and motivation and I genuinely enjoy doing things again. I find myself being able to look forward to things and just enjoy life. A few months ago I couldn’t have imagined any of these lovely feelings returning to me but here they are. I am still working through a depressive episode but I have come a long way thanks to Lexapro. I truly recommend it to anyone struggling with anxiety or depression like I am. Something major I must mention is that Lexapro mainly helped with my depression and not so much my anxiety, but it certainly has made it more tolerable.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Like all of you I read every review on the drugs I have been prescribed. It helps on those really bad days to hear someone has been helped. I was put on Lexapro 20 years ago after a run of deaths in my family and on the fire dept. My doctor explained it like this, you have a natural immunity to bad events, but if you experience too many too quickly you may not be able to return to normal by yourself. After 20 years I began to feel emotionally numb. I weaned myself off Lexapro 20mg thinking I could deal with things myself. Then covid hit, and a run of bad life events again. After the worst year and a half of trying different anti depressants I'm back on Lexapro. Its only been a week and a half but already I feel slightly better. Taking a medicine to improve your life experience is not a weakness, we are only here for a short time try to enjoy it as much as possible.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I have recently decided to try antidepressants after finally acting on the knowledge that I was not happy or thriving in my life.I started Pristiq and took that for 6 weeks. I felt terrible. I was so disappointed and I felt so hopeless. I  worried that I wasn’t depressed but just wasn’t cut out for life or my personality was flawed. I went back to my GP who prescribed Lexapro 10mg. I’ve been taking this for 6-7 weeks now, and my life has absolutely changed. I feel a joy for life that I can never remember ever feeling before, I have energy, I don’t cry every day, I am kicking goals at work, my social life is enriched and I can focus properly. I didn’t realise that I was living in a constant state of anxiety until it went away. If you are considering antidepressants, my best advice is to try them. You might need to try a few, but antidepressants are the best decision I have ever made.

So I have been on Paxil for years and last year at this time I wanted to get off of it so my GP started reducing my dose. I was on 30mg. When I got down to 10mg my depression and GAD came back. So I increased back my dose. But I felt like I did not come back to my self. Anxiety and depression was still there. So after suffering through I talked to my GP and we agreed to try escitalopram. I did a taper of my Paxil for 3 weeks then I started taking 5mg escitalopram with 10mg of Paxil for a week. Now today I started 10mg of escitalopram with no Paxil. Anxiety is still there and having trouble sleeping. But will see. I will give an update in a few weeks to see

I started ciprelex on August 4 in 10 mg and increased the dose to 20 mg after 4 days.My intrusive thoughts are getting better but I have no sex drive and can’t reach an orgasm.Is this common? Does anyone have experienced the same thing? Does sex drive comes back?Thank you.

Hi all I was a previous long term (9 years) user of Citalopram until I weaned off in 2016 for OCD, depression I have been suffering with anxiety ever since. Recently the panic attacks, constant ruminations got much worse and I sunk into a deep depression. My psychiatrist prescribed Escitalopram at 1mg per day (liquid) increasing every 4 days up to 8mg. After the first drop my anxiety eased. I have been taking 8mg for three days and it hasn’t been easy. I spent two of those in bed yet today I feel like the depression is lifting and I feel a lot calmer. I’m 5 weeks in and hope this review helps someone to keep going as I almost stopped the meds 3 days ago! I will update again in a month. Sending hugs to all.

I found the drug very effective and am much better and more positive now but found the dry mouth and ulcers in my mouth painful I also had nausea for the first few weeks. Over all, the end results were positive and it is nice to feel well again. It has made myself more understanding of mental health issues which is good

I resisted taking antidepressants for a really long time. But I got to the point after having some major life changes that everything came to a head. My anxiety was unbearable and I also suffered bad depressive episodes with thoughts of suicide fairly often. The depression mixed with the anxiety was a huge battle and I decided I needed some more help. I started on 5 mg and after 2 weeks I was absolutely amazed at how myself I felt. After a year my anxiety started to creep back in and I was feeling quite low at times so I increased my dose to 10 mg. I’ve had very little side affects and it’s helped me get my life back! I tried weening myself off and realised that actually I was a happier version of myself when getting that bit of help from taking Ecitalopram!

I've been on this medication for the past 2 years on and off.  My last six months I have been extremely depressed. I generally started this for anxiety at 10 mg now I'm a 20 milligram I have missed over a month of doses. I'm not in a good head space. I'm writing this review because today I start my regular dose again and I will be back with another review in a month.  I'm awfully depressed can't sleep, can't get out of bed, can't eat, don't go outside, my daughter is the only joy in my life and the reason I'm not giving up.  So starting tonight I will consistently  take. my medication for the next month and come back with my review. After reading reviews I'm learning that it takes almost two months to feel the effects so here I go. Llease keep my daughter & me in your prayers I just need to feel normal again.I use to be so motivated and happy now I just stare at my phone all night long. I really hope for the best from this medication

Lexapro (escitalopram):This medication pulled me out of a deep and very severe depression, almost instantly after taking it, my mind felt much more clear, my anxiety went away, and I noticed my sense of humor had returned with a vengeance, and my ability to enjoy simple and non simple things in life sky rocketed. I was smiling all the time basically. I’ve been on it for about five months now, and have no plans of discontinuing it ever. This medication was one of the best decisions I’ve ever made in my entire life.  The side effects were difficulty reaching orgasm for about a month and a half, nausea, insomnia and general discomfort for about a month, I couldn’t sleep no matter how hard I tried for about a week straight, then I would get maybe an hour or two a night, after a month my sleep cycle  went back to normal, my ding dong began functioning properly as well as my libido and  nut ability, and the anxiety relief, and depression relief as well as my energy level sky rocketed from the point forward.
20mg has helped me get to the point I can actually accept therapy and WANT to be better.

I have been taking this drug 5mg since 11 days. I have seen no improvement yet and feeling much worse than I was feeling before. Lazy, confused, sleepy, and no desire to do anything just laying in bed. I don’t know if this is the right medicine for me or should I wait a bit longer. Probably is not working for me but that does not mean it will not work for you. Now the pain in the ass is that once you start this drug you cannot just quit cold turkey you need to taper off so I am pretty confused if I should start taper off already or just wait to do its magic. Very confused!I will update this post at one month mark if there are any real changes.
Is making me worse

Lexapro (escitalopram):Negative: Nausea and general discomfort and constant yawning and mild tiredness. I found myself lying in bed all day. My head felt like as if I've been crying, and my body felt slightly detached with a shaky sensation, similar to a bad hangover. Feel a weird anxiety/anguish. Regularly I feel like I’m on the verge of crying for no reason (I never cry). I cannot focus or relax. I became less productive than before. Positive: Got pleasure from simple things and my sense of smell became more vivid. However, it’s only after intense negative effects of the drug wear off. And even then, I need to push myself, for example, hike/work all day. But it's getting more difficult to push myself and I've been pretty much useless. At 4-weeks now and probably stopping, I tried to experiment taking it at night sleeping through the worst part, but it’s a similar deal. It's a shame there is a lot of potential, if it wasn't for all of the side effects I would have considered it a miracle drug.

Someone asked me what it was like being on this medication. Simple. Not on it, I have nothing to be happy about. On it, I have nothing to be unhappy about. Having tried many different medications before this one, I know how incredibly difficult going on and coming off these types of meds is. It’s horrible how if they don’t make you feel better they can make you feel worse. It’s also horrible how long it takes to come off of one and to start a different one. This medication escitalopram has saved me. After initial side effects, I now experience none and 10 years on the same dose whereas I used to have to switch meds after maxing out on the dose and have symptoms return. Know that these meds have a genetic compatibility so if you have a blood relative doing well on this, tell your doctor. I wake up every morning looking forward to the day ahead; you can too.

Been taking this for some time now. I personally feel it helps control my mood swings. I'm less irritable and less dramatic. I feel more in control of my negative feelings, I do find that some times I don't feel anything which is not a bad thing, I just don't feel happy or sad or anything, I don't feel empty. Over all I do think it's helped

Lexapro (escitalopram):I've been on 5mg of Lexapro for 16 days now after being prescribed by my GP. I started off very optimistic and didn't read any reviews of the medication as I didn't want them to influence my experience. I would say that I'm struggling quite a bit at the moment. I'm experiencing dry mouth, heartburn, digestion issues, increased anxiety and depression and suicidal thoughts have increased considerably. I'm not finding joy in any aspect of life at the moment. I've been reading through the reviews and I'm holding out hope that these feelings will change with time. Will update in 2 more weeks.

After catching Covid last year, it left me with long Covid and depression. It took 8 weeks to start having an effect on my mental health, slowly as the months went past, escitalopram helped with fast heart rate, temperature regulation, sickness, then pain in my joints and gradually improving tiredness and fatigue, I have noticed improvements over 9 months.I have put on a bit of extra weight.I was hesitant to go on any anti depression medication. But am glad I did. I would certainly recommend this. But it’s not a quick fix

Lexapro (escitalopram):Lexapro really did save my life. Have been on it for ten years on 20mg. About 6 months ago i decided with my doctor to wean of it over a space of about 3 months. I had been off it for 2 months and was feeling fantastic.Well, 3 weeks ago I crashed and all the old depressive symptoms and anxiety are back.Doctor put me back on 10mg for the first week then 15mg. It has been nearly 3 weeks back on medication and the roller coaster ride of emotions is draining. I know it will kick in after about 4 - 6 weeks and now realize I need to be on this drug for the rest of my life.It has saved me before and will save me again.Highly recommend. 10/10

Lexapro (escitalopram):I've been on Lexapro for around 5 years now and my Dr. is having me switch to prozac because of weight gain..Lexapro had almost no side effects for me except increased appetite and gradual weight gain.  It did help with mood for probably the first year or two but I feel like the benefits have worn off. I've noticed it doesn't do much to help my anxiety either. While it was a great med at first, I would probably need a higher dose to continue receiving the benefits. And weight gain became a definite problem for me!  I was on 20mg for years but decreased to 10mg to see if that would help with my weight, but unfortunately no.Not everyone will have this issue on Lexapro but it's definitely something to watch out for!

I just want to note that this medication changed my life completely & I hope it can help others like it helped me. It helped me with my anxiety & depression over time. It was so bad I couldn’t live a normal life. It took a while to settle in. I didn’t want to take this medication. But trust the process. It did make me gain a little weight the first few months. It did make my mouth feel dry at first. Just give it time for your body to adjust to it. I feel so much better, I feel back to my normal self.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I didn't have a nightmare experience with Lexapro, it simply just didn't work for me I've been on 10mg for a little over three months and Lexapro hasn't helped with my anxiety, panic attacks at all. I will say that it has helped my depression just a little bit, but not really enough. I started taking it during a really bad depressive episode and I felt a little bit better after a few weeks of taking it, but I've also felt bad again on it so I think it was just me going through the natural fluctuation of my depression. I couldn't go up to 20mg because I was already having side effects at 10mg and I didn't want to make it worse. No crazy side effects, just feeling like I need to sleep for 14 hours and always feeling tired and out of it. Also, I have a general loss of motivation. Obviously depression takes away your motivation, but its a slight constant numb feeling. I've tried other SSRIs that made me feel like I had no emotions and Lexapro didn't do that thankfully.
Don’t know where I'd be without it. So grateful. Takes a month or less to start working in my opinion started on 5 mg and realised I need 10mg.

I’ve been on this pill for about 4 days now, I’ve been reading all these comments of people saying to stick with it. And before reading this I really wanted to stop this pill. My depression is at an all time low and I feel like a zombie all day, constant headaches and I can only get 2-3 hours of relief a day before taking the pill again. It’s extremely hard as I have a 1 year old and I know it’s putting a heavy load of anxiety for my fiancé. I’ve been waking up 3am in a panic and I’ve been very confused lately. I’m hoping that I can stick out the pain and I’m really hoping that this pill will give me my life back.
Lexapro (escitalopram):I was on it for a depressive bipolar episode and it’s been a disaster, non stop cycling and never ending mixed episodes. Not great for bipolar disorder.

I’m 19 and this is the first anti-depressant I have ever taken. I have been taking it for about a month. I take 10 mg a day at night. I took half a pill for about a week and then was told to start taking a full pill.  The first few days I took it I did have some mild stomach issues but I think it was because of something else, and it went away in a few days. I feel much more motivated and lifted up. I use to spiral pretty much everyday and cry everyday. Since I started taking it I’ve only cried a handful of times. When I get depressive thoughts I am able to just move on and not cry. It is really refreshing as someone who is over emotional and cries a lot. I feel excited for life and want to try new things. I’m also able to think more rationally when like doing CBT exercises and journaling. I also have anxiety, OCD and social anxiety. I do think it has helped with my anxiety. Overall, I would say I just feel lifted up and in a better state of mind.

I was put on this drug for dysthymia and social phobia, in combination with dextroamphetamine, which I took on an as needed basis. The dexies were effective at boosting mood and reducing social inhibitions, but could also increase anxiety. As for Escitalopram, I can’t say I noticed any changes for good or ill. I’m surprised by all the positive (and negative) reviews for this and other SSRIs, as my own experience and the data make me suspect these are little more than sugar pills. Still, if it’s working for you, fantastic. A goo effect is a good effect, right? On the other hand, if you’re not helped by SSRIs and their ilk, ask to try Nardil, which is like a laser canon to Lexapro’s pop gun.Why did I stay on escitalopram for years despite my skepticism as to its efficacy? I guess I thought well, it’s not doing any harm... Plus, as irrational as it sounds, while I wasn’t convinced it was helping, I was still afraid to go off it in case things got worse.

I can't say don't take this drug because every drug is different for everyone. It didn't work for me but it could work for you. It's so scary to try out new medications with the fear that your body might react weird or bad to it, but I tried a few and I eventually went on Fluoxetine which is generic version of prozac and that worked so amazing for me! This process is scary, but when you find the right one, it is life changing. ALSO, PLEASE GIVE THE MEDICATION TIME TO WORK!!!! You will most likely have side effects for the first 2 weeks or so. But week 3 or 4 you should feel a difference if it's going to work for you!

Lexapro (escitalopram):After going into a deep depression after a divorce, with two young children to love, care for and support, I began having major anxiety attacks lasting all day all night long, I Was unable to sleep, I could not eat I lost 40 pounds my weight plummeted to 90 pounds I felt helpless, I useless, I’d almost lost all hope of knowing what joy was.  I knew I was in trouble and I had to be honest with myself and get help. After being prescribed Lexapro within three weeks my entire outlook on life changed for the better, my energy came back I was able to sleep again. I beg anyone having trouble with depression please don’t feel embarrassed, don’t think you’re weak because you need help you are not.
Is been 6 weeks I am on Escitalopram and it still hasn’t made much difference. Can anyone help me or advice me please.

I am a 20 yr old female and have had depression and anxiety for 4 years now (it’s genetic). I stopped my 150mg WellbutrinXL a day and got back on it both last year. I’ve been on WellbutrinXL since December 18th, 2020. I was taking 150mg a day at night and decided to up my dose to 150mg twice a day; 1 morning dose and 1 night dose. This helped a lot, but I was still struggling mostly with anxiety but still had some unwanted depression tendencies and thoughts. I started taking 5mg Lexapro on February 16th, 2021, at night with my WellbutrinXL dose. Within days, I felt a difference. So much happier and more positive outlook on life. 4 weeks and 1 day later, Lexapro has truly changed my life for the better. It has completely helped my anxiety and gotten rid of the rest of the depressive thoughts. I thank God everyday for blessing me with this medication. Medication is a different experience for everyone. But this has REALLY helped me and changed my life forever! ❤️ Ask your DR.

Lexapro (escitalopram):HiIt helped to read everyones comments about lexapro,  I have autoimmune disease and react strongly to any medication.I tried 5 mgs yesterday and felt horrible.  Difficulty concentration spacey forgetful so I decided not to take it today.  I felt better off it until I started to get depressed and worried .  I worry a lot and overreact to medical problems .  My Dr said now take 2 1/2 after dinner and if I get any side effects go lay down.  I am scared that I will get those side effects but I felt better after I read everyones comments and hope I will do well on it.  Cause I cannot function like this.  Keep fingers crossed.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I've been on Lexapro for a year. I resisted it because I was afraid meds would take a toll on my overall health longterm (ie maybe give me hypertension, acne, weight gain, hair loss, etc). But I want to tell anyone that is hesitant to start SSRI's: stress/depression take a toll on your body. I was beating myself up mentally and emotionally, bringing myself to tears and destroying my self-esteem, telling myself I was worthless. This was my life. If you think that treating yourself like this isn't hurting your body, with all the terrible things stress/depression do on the cellular level, you're wrong. Potential side effects of SSRI's aren't as bad as depression. I feel so much better now. I don't tear myself down and cry every night. I don't catastrophize. I move on from things when they don't work out instead of taking a week to convince myself I've ruined my life. I am NOT "CURED", but that ISN'T what the SSRI'S are for. It's for giving you help, space, so you can work on yourself and heal.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I was prescribed Lexapro in September of 2020 for OCD and Depression. Starting at 10mg, I gradually worked my way up to 40mg. I was on it until December of 2020.I naively thought Lexapro would help alleviate my anxiety and depression. Only a few weeks after starting the prescription, my brain fog went from bad to absolutely awful. I began to have searing headaches, 24/7; it felt as if someone was tightening a belt around my head and making it swell up. Electrical shocks/"brain zaps" were frequent. My intrusive thoughts got 10x worse. I also acquired a voracious appetite. I gained 40 pounds in three months while on Lexapro. I still suffer from intense brain pain and headaches, and I'm now seeing a neurologist to help deal with this excruciating pain. I can hardly get up and do work in the morning. Be warned: even if you stop taking Lexapro, the side effects continue well after you've tapered off of it.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Was a few times on and off the drug. Never had problems starting or stopping. However I never was on a high dose (10mg max). The  first time I felt it helped. After some time I felt it was not helping and when I stopped it didn't make any meaningful difference. Took it again a few times afterwards for a couple of weeks, but stopped again as it didn't help at all. Side effects were quite low for me. The first few doses were very activating and I had trouble sleeping, but it went away quickly. Some minor sexual side effects. Very good in terms of (lack) of meaningful side effects, but limited improvements on my condition. I suspect for me it was not due to lack of serotonin, but dopamine instead.
The only thing that I stayed on long term. Do not mix with alcohol, I used to never listen to the warnings. Listen to them.

I was prescribed escitalopram for my depression, anxiety and OCD. I am also autistic (Asperger's syndrome) and have neurological issues. I also had a difficult life; went through many bad events - I've been suicidal since childhood. I believe that my problems stem from trauma and not different brain chemistry. Every time I took escitalopram, it felt like I was on amphetamines; I couldn't sleep, had motor tics and spoke very fast. I thought I was going to die - I felt a very uncomfortable sensation on my chest, deep down inside. I'm not sure how to describe it but it was one of the most unpleasant feelings I've ever felt.I am sure that I am overly sensitive to medication and I will never take this drug again.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I started taking Lexapro in 2019 as my first medication for depression. It was horrible. In a way it made my depression better, but I felt more depressed than ever, just in a different way, it’s hard to explain. It dropped my sex drive to 0. It got rid of my memory and made it impossible for me to focus on anything so I started failing classes. I ate and slept more, which made me feel horrible due to my ED. It made me completely numb, I couldn’t feel any emotion at all, positive or negative. I had no interest in doing anything. Because of Lexapro I had more suicidal ideations and started self-harming again. I stopped taking it after 3 months of waiting for it to get better. I was open minded about antidepressants but after that I was terrified to try again. Over a year later I am finally talking to my doctor about trying something else.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Would have worked for someone with just depression, but I had bipolar disorder (and postpartum depression) which  I didn’t know at the time. It was good at first, but then after awhile I had really bad depression. If you have depression make sure your doctor rules out bipolar disorder.
Helped cure my depression. 10/10.

I was on 10-15mg for 5 months. While I was on it I felt like it really helped me and it actually did, I didn't feel suicidal anymore and I was in a better state mentally. But the physical side effects were too much for me to handle and kind of cancelled out the good effects. I was extremely tired and constantly fatigued. I could have slept all the time and couldn't get anything done. I just stayed at home where I sort of felt happy, but I wasn't living my life. I gained 10kg while on it, which wasn't directly from the drug but the fact that I had no energy to cook and just ate junk food and sweets all the time. Only when I quit escitalopram and changed to vortioxetine, I realised how badly it affected me. Now I feel back to normal again and I can actually get stuff done instead of wanting to sleep all the time.

Lexapro (escitalopram):This medication did wonders for me with the least side effects. I started slow at 2.5 mg and spent most of the time only 5 mg. Toward the end I upped to 10 mg but it seemed to stop working after 8 years or so. I've weaned myself off it which was tough (but doable thanks to the liquid option). My time on it was worth it and I would still recommend over other antidepressants.

I took Lexapro 10 mg for 2 years and it did help with my depression for awhile. However, at around the 2 year mark I became very agitated and aggressive. I could not reach climax during sex, I gained 20 lbs slowly over the 2 years, and I would poop about 6 times every day BEFORE 10 am. I also had absolutely zero energy and just wanted to lay around all day. This is what probably contributed to the weight gain. My doc has switched me to Zoloft and added Abilify to stabilize my moods.
Akathisia Maniac episodes Irritated Agitation Confused thinking

In the first two weeks on escitalopram I felt like throwing up all the time with some occasional panic attacks at night which scared because it never happened before. But I’ve been on escitalopram for 2 months now and I feel good! I don’t have nausea and the panic attacks stopped. I experience way less anxiety than before. Since I am stuck at home due to the pandemic I cannot say that my life is all bright now and I still spend some of my days lying in bed with no motivation but! when I get sad it’s not overwhelming. When I think about how things currently suck, I don’t feel suicidal and I can say to myself that there will be better times. Also, I feel some delay in my sexual responses and overall my sex drive is a tiny bit lower but it’s not really a problem. This med did not turn me into a ray of sunshine and I sometimes still come across as a negative person... but I am able to do the things that I must, waking up is not a battle anymore and I look forward to brighter times!

I've only just been on Lexapro for a month now, 5mgs. Its been treating me really well, my only side effect is this weird rush of anxiety like three hours after taking it, but because I know its the medication, it doesn't freak me out as bad. It hasn't ruined my sex drive or ability to orgasm, I still laugh at everything, I feel a full spectrum of emotions. No numbing feeling in any regard that many have expressed, thankfully. its a low dosage but I am young and a smaller person so it works just fine for me. I'm very happy to be on Lexapro, it has definitely changed me for the better. Im much more levelheaded now. I suffer from anxiety, depression and BPD. It has been helping me significantly.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I’m in my early 30s. This was my first time taking antidepressants after struggling with depression and anxiety since I was a teenager. It did a great job of managing my depression and anxiety. It took the edge off and evened me out emotionally. I stopped being irritable and snapping at all those around me, I didn’t sweat the small stuff, and I didn’t get stuck in negative thought patterns. I no longer had intrusive thoughts. It made me a better person. There is a downside: the weight gain. In the first 8 months of being on Lexapro I put on 20 pounds. Over the next 12 months I put on an additional 22 lbs, and was tipping the scales at 212lbs, 42lbs more than my normal weight. When I started outgrowing size large shirts I decided that enough was enough and stopped taking Lexapro. Within 6 months I was back to 170lbs and I didn’t change anything about my eating habits or workouts. If anything I was eating way worse than before. I will probably try a new AD at some point.

I was prescribed 10mg and then increased to 20mg after two weeks as it was having little or no effect on my depression. Over the next couple of weeks I became more and more anxious which was something I hadn't experienced before. I was advised to persevere which I did, it now seems to have tailed off a little.I still have dark days but they don't seem as intense. Insomnia is a big issue, I take my meds at 5am before work so theoretically the effects should tail off, by 9pm I'm exhausted and fall asleep pretty quickly but 3 hours later I'm awake and unable to sleep again. It's almost like a hard drive spinning up and staying maxed,  accompanied with an almost audible buzz of white noise.It is still early days but I'm hoping the side effects back off sooner rather than later.

Lexapro (escitalopram):This pill changed my life. I was very skeptical to take it after reading about the terrible side effects. Indeed I had awful side effects within the first weeks including waking up shaking, increased anxiety and an increase in suicidal thoughts. In fact I begged the doctor to change me onto something else but he told me to stick with it. After 4 weeks I was absolutely transformed and I still honestly can’t believe the change it made to me. I’m no longer crying everyday, I’ve started enjoying all the things I used to and rediscovering myself. I’m no longer angry or unable to contain my emotions.I was in the position you were reading reviews and asking myself if this can really help me. It can! My advice is stick with it because the side effects can be heavy but for me it has changed everything - so much so that I felt I had to come back to write this in the hope of helping others that were in my position!

Lexapro (escitalopram):Such an amazing drug. It really saved my life, worth all the side effects in the beginning. Everything balanced out and I finally feel more like myself.It lessens the horrible feelings of I'm not good enough and it calms my nerves quite a bit. Unfortunately, it calms down my sex life quite a bit too, I still manage, still good but takes longer and thats the only long term problem I've seen. Still gets 10/10!! #LOVE LEX

I guess Lexapro at least slightly lowers my lows so I can't give it a 1/10. Other than that this was a complete flop. Felt great for about a week on 10mg of it, then the mental fog started to set in. I feel like my brain never clicks on during the day at all. I have trouble motivating myself to do anything. It also blunts the rare mood highs I get too, so I end up in an uncomfortable grey zone all the time and feel like a zombie. Taking it at night results in insomnia so I can't even do that.I'd rather deal with the lows and still feel things than be a blank slate 24/7.
Lexapro (escitalopram):Lexapro works for me, tried a few others and they weren't helpful. I take a very light dose of 5mg daily, it's enough to smooth off the worst whilst still staying human.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I was having an issue with gastroenterology, and no doctors were able to find the reason. One doc suggested lexapro, and aftér a couple of months it was gone! Everyday I feel good.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I used to overthink to the point where I could not sleep or think straight sometimes. I was just so exhausted I didn’t want to eat much it was terrible I don’t wish anxiety or depression on anyone. I started taking lexapro about 3 months ago and it has been awesome it makes me feel better and I can sleep better and my appetite is back!! If you experience negative overthinking you should try this !! Good luck !!

Lexapro (escitalopram):I was put on Lexapro after a nervous breakdown in 2005.  I had to quit working since Lexapro only intensified my depression.  I lost any interest in eating, hygiene or things I loved to do.  Each time I saw the nurse practitioner, I told her I was getting worse and begged her to take me off it.  She refused, telling me "I like trying to play with the dosages".  I continued down a black hole to the point I couldn't even eat.  Finally when I broke down crying and begging her to try me on something else.  She put me on Zoloft.  In months I was MUCH better.

I was prescribed this drug about 3 years ago when a bout with anxiety/slight depression caused me to stop eating and sleeping, resulting in a very difficult time. 4 days into the pill I had more anxiety than I ever felt before and stopped in favour of St Johns wort which helped for 3 years. Then COVID hit and I found myself in a similar spot with even worse depression. I started on this drug 5 weeks ago - 1 week at 5mg, 4 weeks at 10mg and just starting at 15mg yesterday. Around the 3rd week, I was feeling really great and then a weekend hit where I couldn’t get out of bed. I spoke to my doctor who said to go up to 15mg. Some increased anxiousness in the AM and I’m bit more tired but that’s the only side effects so far. This far into my journey, I am so happy I tried this again and I know I will find my sweet spot with the dosage. Stick with it - it can be hard but it’s so so worth it!

Lexapro (escitalopram):I had taken Lexapro from 2017 and on and off until spring of 2019. I was recently prescribed this medicine again, and it may have changed in formula or I may have changed chemically in the last year, but not the same side effects. What used to just be yawning and some drowsiness as a beginning side effect turned into nausea and syncope and bed ridden for the last few days. Glad it works for some people, but with my lifestyle I don’t have time for it to go away. I will try something else.

Lexapro (escitalopram):This medicine Lexapro has completely took away my anxiety and is slowly taking down the depression. It took about 8 days for these positive effects to take place, stay patient with this medicine and stay positive and it will change your life. The only side effects I had were drowsiness and decrease in sex drive but those effects are slowly going away. I get excited everyday knowing each pill I take is a step closer to full recovery. God bless!!!

Lexapro (escitalopram):Overall, Lexapro has been very helpful in treating my MDD and GAD. It has lowered my anxiety substantially and helped my cope with depression. While it has left me with severe insomnia, I would take that over MDD and GAD anytime.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I started taking Lexapro 6 months ago at a 10mg dosage the first few weeks I was extremely sleepy and still depressed but slightly better.  I knew it would get worse before it got better (I read lots of reviews) but slowly but surely it started to work.  I am exercising again and more social.  I am in menopause and suffer from PTSD and anyone who has suffered does not want that dark feeling again.  After 5 months My Dr. upped my dosage to 20 mg and it has helped even more.  This dosage lasts all day and I just feel like my old self again.  Be patient Lexapro gave me my life back

Lexapro (escitalopram):Have been on Lexapro for approximately 2 years. The side effects came slowly. The past few months could barely get out of bed, suffered from vertigo, no motivation to do anything, sat on the couch most of the day. I am weaning myself off the medication right now. The change is amazing. I have energy I look forward to getting up in the morning. We'll discuss with the doctor and alternative. I take bupropion so I should be okay.

I was started on escitalopram 5 mg now on 10mg to help with my menopausal moods. I have been on it for 2/3 years really want to come off it. I sweat all the time, sadly I only read about side effects recentlyI also get off balance a lot really unlike me can’t wait to get off it of course slowly

I was put on escitalopram around a year ago and weaned myself off about three months ago without advice from my psychiatrist to do so. The medicine definitely worsened if not caused me to pull my hair out. After stopping it I went from having the irresistible urge to pull throughout the day and night to having absolutely no urge at all for the past two months that the medicine has been out of my system.

I have been battling with my swing moods ,anxiety , depression and obsessive Compulsive Disorder for long time , almost 16 years( I am 35 years old).I  didn't believe before that drugs could be helpful for me , I was so wrong.I now see that. I have been on my escitalopram for 3 weeks , I am discovering right now , how much my body has gone through unnoticed and stress I have been through . No drug is a miracle I have some libido problems. Here comes the long lasting issue:"drugs have side effects and they are not natural ", yeah thats right BUT!! If I don't take those drugs I would be in a Pysch ward right now. The problem is not if drugs are perfect or not, the problem is the daily life pushed me so far that I can't cope without assistance, if you have so much to handle and so little to fight against those obstacles , your psychology gets crushed one way or another during time . in an ideal world nobody would require medications . If I compare my options , I am very happy with my medication

For many years I have had depression off and on.  I have been taking escitalopram 10 mg dose since 16/7/20, then the dose was increased on the 1/8/20 to 15mg.So in total I've been on it 6 weeks.I feel slightly better not much if I’m honest.Should I give this tablet a bit longer?Any suggestions?

I have been taking this medicine escitalopram for a year. In the long term the reaction of my body to it was slight constipation and major one was inability to wake up early. I was not sad but not happy either. I think fluoxetine is a better option compared to escitalopram. It really helped in case of libido that it stopped premature ejaculation. I think life is more colourful on fluoxetine than compared to escitalopram.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I was prescribed Lexapro (Escitalopram) after complaining of severe moodiness after my bi-weekly testosterone shot was administered. The very first and last pill I will would ever take. I had a very extreme battle with Suicidal Tendencies - with just one pill! I drank so much water to help flush out of my system and after a full 24 hours later, I feel I'm out of danger. Please! Please!! Recognize the symptoms and fight through it. Get off of it immediately should you have similar reaction and notify your doctor. Hope I was able to help someone.

I use the generic form of Lexapro and I have seen a very noticeable difference in myself. And its very obvious to others as well. I smile and laugh so much more and I feel like the real me. I take 10mg a day and I stand by it. No joke. I'm glad it works for me. I have been taking it for a very short period of time and my serotonin levels have GOT to be better because THE way I act and feel now isn't a coincidence.

Please please don't go near this drug escitalopram I think it is awful. I've been taking it for over a month and the anxiety is really bad, thankful it's in the process of being changed but I had to call the out of hours team because I thought I was have a panic attack don't go near this drug
Took escitalopram 10 mg for 3 weeks for anxiety and depression. 7 months since then I am taking Cialis

I’m a 46 year old woman and I’ve been taking Lexapro for 6 years. My experience has been very positive. I felt like it helped me get back to my normal self. It helps me keep level. I don’t have panic attacks. I don’t feel so drastically up and down. It’s helped me stay rational.

The short version : escitalopram works and it starts working almost immediately but for me it’s too similar to Zoloft which made me suicidal so I don’t think it is a good long-term solution for me.Nauseous jittery emotionally  numb and almost feeling like life is just a lucid dream a sort of out of body experience. If you have had bad experiences with SSRIS in the past I don’t believe I can recommend this except as an immediate short-term intervention for suicidal ideation

I have  PTSD induced psychosis with depression Been taking this for 3 days so far, my head feels really heavy today, and I've been getting anxiety when it first starts to kick in, then it goes away, once the pill fully kicks in. Then after only 8 hours, the pill wears off and I get a pretty bad panic attack again and my intrusive thoughts come back, causing psychosis. The first 2 days I got dizziness and diarrhea, my girlfriend is taking me to see a doctor tomorrow about either upping my dose or seeing if it is alright to take 2 a day, or even 10.5mg. So far though, it's been amazing for taking my intrusive thoughts away though.

I started using escitalopram about 2 months ago and I'm defiantly a little better but the side effects are a bit different than the last one I used (sertraline/ Zoloft). When I was on that I was nauseous for a month but then it got better. But this is something else. instead of being nauseous and not eating I am instead not hungry at all. I haven't felt the urge to eat for about a month and the strange thing is I have binge eating disorder so that is very different from what I'm used to.  Yet I have ok energy except when the drug wheres off.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I have had a terrible experience on Lexapro. I was having hormonal issues after a possible miscarriage and I was prescribed Lexapro when I cried in the doctors office. I have never been on birth control so this is the first thing my body has taken in (regularly) I am 21. Been on this medication makes me overheat VERY easily and I now have red blemishes on my cheeks 24/7. I get sick often and my bad days are bad. And I mean bad, I was not like this previously but I do not see a difference and I felt like I was doing better on my own

Lexapro (escitalopram):I was on Lexapro for the last 3 years due to depression.  I felt much better at first, but absolutely hate the side affects.  It cut my sex drive way down and made me lose muscle/weight, no matter how hard I worked out.  The withdrawal symptoms are not fun, but after weaning myself off it, I feel so much better with my normal energy and libido back.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Let me start off by saying that Lexapro was the first medication that I went on to combat my anxiety and depression. At first I was optimistic about medication but after taking lexapro I was totally shaken up. It caused me to have severe mood swings, I went from the happiest I’ve ever been in my life, all the way down to rock bottom in not even 2-3 hours. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND

Lexapro (escitalopram):I suffer from depression and anxiety, My doctor put me on 10mg of lexapro. My Depression didn't feel as intense as it would but it did not help my anxiety. I would feel really dreamy when I would go out, it made my anxiety worse. I stopped using it after 3 weeks.

I put off seeing a doctor for long enough.  Then I  started 10mg dose after ~5 years of battling depression and trying many natural alternatives which didn’t help. From the first dose I experienced no negative side effects, 3 weeks in now I definitely notice an improvement. The constant underlying sadness has eased and while I feel it’s still too early to say it’s gone completely, coz I would often experience waves where the sadness would hit worse and these were spontaneous, I’m optimistic. To those reading the mixed reviews here and unsure whether it’s worth trying, please consider it. I put off being on antidepressants for too long and while this won’t work for everyone, it’s absolutely worth a shot.

escitalopram is a fantastic serotonin booster.  After only three days of taking it, I was back to my old self - all the frightening symptoms of chronic depression had gone.  It does lessen your libido which could be a problem for those in a relationship. I personally cannot recommend it enough, it's life changing.  Thank god for Lexapro.

I am a 28 year old woman, I have suffered depression with suicidal tendencies since I was 15 years old. I tried multiple medications and some worked ok, but it wasn’t until I was 26 that I began to experience a panic disorder, I would have debilitating panic attacks that where making think I was losing my mind. I went to the doctors and they put me in lexapro, it has been the best medication by FAR! Depression is non existent, I have not had one single panic attack in nearly 2 years. This is just my experience, but I hope that for someone potentially going through something similar to what I have, might read this and really give it a go.The only side affect that I get is a really low libido. But compared to suicidal depression and debilitating anxiety, a low sex drive is worth it.

Was prescribed escitalopram just about 5 months ago and it was the worst experience I've ever had on a drug. Worked within the first 10 minutes of taking it which was weird because I was told I'd feel better within a couple weeks and I need to give it time. Felt so incredibly numb, my emotions where completely blocked off and I had horrible brain fog, I couldn't do anything!!!! I suffer from dissociation also and it made it 10x worse for me. I couldn't get to sleep and when I eventually did I woke up in a pool of sweat, not to mention I was constantly thirsty. I vowed never to take antidepressants again but now I'm thinking it was just that specific antidepressant I went on. So heres hoping giving it another shot will help me. Because this antidepressant made me feel 10x worse.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I am a 24 year old woman who’s anxiety and depression has recently worsened to an extreme. Desperate for help I consulted my doctor she started me on Lexapro 10mg a day she told me to split it in half and take 5mg the first few days. It took me to the darkest place I have ever been honestly. The first day I was in the ER with a severe panic I attack, I was right back the next day. The reason I felt like I was having the attacks is because the medicine was causing a severe burning/tingling sensations in my arms and legs that would not stop. And my hands and feet would not stop sweating it made me feel like I had something else going on but everything came back normal. The ER doctors told me to hang in there and that things might get worse before they get better. But I honestly physically couldn’t take it. So I have stopped it. And kudos to you guys who did stay strong and are seeing the benefits from it now ❤️

If you're going thru stress, a break up, low motivation, or just a bad time and you can't shake it or keep diving deeper into that hole, PLEASE TAKE LEXAPRO. It is not a happy drug it literally just clears your brain. It helps you stay sane and level headed. I can't thank my doctor enough.

Prescribed 10mg and taken first time today. Was so excited to take it. My first antidepressant and have been living with depression my whole life. (28 year old female.)Within the hour I felt a hot ball of energy develop in my chest. It felt like something woke up inside of me. I got up after few min to cook and started to feel very faint, felt like I was going to pass out. Walked a few steps and vomited on the floor. Ran to the bathroom to vomit more and felt like I was doped up. My brain felt foggy and I felt like a zombie. The next few hours were terrible. I felt a hot electrical current through my body and the worst head fog I have ever felt. I actually preferred to be depressed than to feel the effects of this medicine. I tried to sleep it off. But my body fell asleep before my mind did. Woke up soaked in sweat. Still heat spots around my body and some tingling. My brain is so foggy I can’t recall much information. I don’t feel like getting out of bed.

I have been on this drug  escitalopram for 1 year. It has changed my life. I was going thru a lot of changes in my life and my Dr. suggested it. Recently I have upped the dose from 10mg to 20mg and because I'm dealing with anxiety as well. For those that have trouble sleeping on it, my Dr. gave me trazadone as an add on. Best nights sleep and I feel refreshed in the morning.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I have been having mood swings due to not being able to control my depression and anxiety. It got so bad that my boyfriend would welcome me with a hug as soon as I got home from work and I would snap at him to stop crowding me. Anyway, my dr finally put me on 20mg of lexapro and I have been the coolest cucumber ever. Every little thing that used to irritate me just ceased to exist in my mind. My mother said she missed how easy breezy I used to be and I feel like I'm finally back to my normal self.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Spiral led into horrific depression with anxiety. After a couple meds I tried Lexapro. After a few weeks and some bearable side effects I felt a cloud lift and it kept getting better. At first I took max dose with Abilify and occasional Ativan, but eventually I was able to stop both of those. So here’s the hard part,  it worked awesome for 8 years. The only side effects were 20 lbs weight gain and lessened manifold- a small price to pay when you felt how I did. But then I was in a period of insane stress and re-traumatized and suddenly the med would not work. It’s been a journey since, but I am so grateful for the quality of life I had for those 8 years.

Lexapro (escitalopram):My doc put me on 10mg of generic lexapro probably a year ago. I saw no change in mood and anxiety attacks continued regularly. Two months ago she increased my dosage to 20mg. After about 1 1/2 months I noticed a horrible personality decline. Sad constantly, anxiety increased, dark thoughts which includes suicidal thoughts. I started cutting, anger increase where I am throwing things, banging head on wall, and began drinking again after 4 1/2 years of sobriety.  Taking this dosage is the only thing that has changed in my life, all other stresses are the same. Called my doctor and said I wanted off of this med completely. She didn’t feel that I have given the new dose enough time. I don’t care.  I’m getting off of it so I am in the process of decreasing dosage and hope to be off of it completely within 3 months max.

After about 10 days of taking Elicea I started to feel amazing! No suicide thoughts - no looking back, only looking forward to my new (wifeless) life.  Does kind of soften sexual desire and make it harder to get aroused, but not impossible.  No regrets for me!

Lexapro (escitalopram):I’ve been on Lexapro for about three months now. I was prescribed 5mg a day by my doctor after experiencing ongoing depression and anxiety. The first week was really hard, my doctor warned me that my anxiety levels would rise and they did. I couldn’t sleep, I was extremely anxious and the depression had worsened as well. I was also extremely nauseous. After about a week those side effects began to subside. I’d  say that after two weeks I started feeling a difference, it was easier to get out of bed and get through the day. After a month it was even better, I felt like those depression glasses had lifted and I was feeling like myself again. I have been feeling so energetic, determined, confident and happy. It’s important to realize that it isn’t a magic pill, all of my progress came with hard work and therapy, Lexapro just gave me a fighting chance. I'd also like to add that I still have bad days, But they’re not quite as bad. I have had no side affects since that first week.

I have started taking this medication a week ago. It hasn't been easy, because the side effects for me, were complicated. A lot of nausea and terrible insomnia. I went back to the doctor who added Prazepam with escitalopram for 3 weeks. I have been battling depression for a long time, and severe fatigue.  I became so accustomed to being low that I had accepted that life was like this. Now, (bearing in mind it has only been a week), I had a glimpse of how life can be. Before I describe it as me swimming in a dark sea, but I can see myself seeing this black sea with a bit of a distance, and not swimming in it. It feels good. I HATE being on meds, but I won't swap it for swimming in the black sea , that is for sure. I have not given a 10 because I have not been long enough on it.

I started taking lexapro because I had bad anxiety and depression from school.  The first few days I took this medication, I was extremely nauseous and felt like I was going to vomit all the time.  After the nausea went away, I noticed that I was always tired, wasn't motivated to do anything, and had trouble concentrating while studying.  Although I did notice that I didn't feel as anxious, the side effects weren't worth it for me so now I am currently trying to taper off and stop taking it.

Lexapro the worst antidepressant to withdraw from in my experience. During withdrawal from  Lexapro  I experienced rage, episodes of intense suicidal thoughts,  and uncomfortable "swooshing " in my head. Be prepared not to be able to drive at times because of this. Also, insomnia.  I could not sleep all night for weeks while tapering. While on Lexapro I gained 40 lbs,  though I was told Lexapro is a weight neutral antidepressant by both the Doctor and Pharmacist.  Not true.Sexual desire and ability to orgasm is nonexistent  on while taking Lexapro. Also, be prepared to possibly lose your boyfriend or girlfriend due to emotional blunting.  You will say or do things that are uncharacteristic of you naturally. Imagine being sociopathic, that is how you will come across. The only pro, this got rid of depression and any suicidal thoughts or feelings quite quickly. Research scholarly reports thoroughly.  Note the source.
The first day of using  escitalopram I've had a terrible headache, felt nauseous and tired, but later I could only feel just tiredness. The medication helped me a lot. It gave my life back.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Caused nausea, vomiting, black outs and unwanted thoughts. Ending up in the psyc ward for a week. After a DNA test found out I metabolize this medication extremely quickly to the point its unsafe for use.
Lexapro is the better antidepressant out there.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Took Lexapro 20 mg for 2 years for depression. It was efficacious for depression, however I became lazy and unmotivated with memory deficiency towards the end. I used to spend most of my free time before this medication doing outdoor activities such as hiking, biking, fishing, surfing, skiing, and such. However while on this drug all I did was lay on the couch and do nothing. Stopped taking it and within a week motivation to do things I onced loved was back and my memory is not nearly as faulty as it was while on drug. Withdrawal symptoms- yes. Brain zaps mostly occur in dark hours of day, evening they slowly come on but while sleeping they are worst. Also night sweats. Did this drug relieve depression-yes.
