Did it make me into an unmotivated couch potato and stop doing all the activities I once loved- yes. Did my working memory severely go faulty- yes. Positives are it brought me out of suicidal thinking and as a male-47 with normal premature ejaculation, made me last longer.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I took this medication about 10 months for depression. I know people who this drug has done wonders for, I just wish I were one of those people. The first week on lexapro I felt great. My sense of humor came back, I wanted to be social, I was less anxious. The first month was great. The second two months were good. After that it just became a pill I took at night that didn’t do anything. I didn’t feel a lot of emotion after awhile. I started to crave it. I actually missed my anxiety because at least that felt human. I went off lexipro after 10 months. I did it cold turkey, which I would NOT recommend. That was bad. After a few weeks I was my old self again but the depression was still there.
Lexapro (escitalopram):Lexapro is ok. I'm on 20mg and noticed that my legs ache...not sure if this is from Lexapro or not.. will discuss with my doc
Lexapro (escitalopram):All I have to say is lexapro saved my life! Give it a chance to work! The best
Since I've been using this  escitalopram my anxiety attacks have limited....I can now breathe through them without my anxiety taking over....I'm loving this

I’m 18 years old and have generalized depression and anxiety. I started off with a dose of 5 mg escitalopram which gave me a bit of insomnia at first and lethargy but it worked for little while and then I realized I had to up the dose due to my anxiety and depression coming back stronger. When I changed to 10 mg, I cannot describe to you the CONSTANT tiredness. I feel like no matter how much sleep I get, I’ll always be tired. Along with the constant sleeping I feel like it’s only worsening my depression and my want to do any activity such as just showering or even trying to clean. Would not recommend this at all.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Was on lexapro for 6 years before switching to something else as I was feeling mild depression and ongoing lethargy. After a few other meds I'm back on the lexapro for 2 weeks. Since my first dose something had changed. My anxiety got worse and my depression has gone to a really dark place including suicidal thoughts. I also need klonopin to sleep and wonder if that's countering the effects of the lexapro. Either way I'm not sure if I should just stop it altogether or stick it out another week or two to see if theres a  change. So far I've had maybe one good day out of the past 15 since I started back at 10mg

First time taking SSRI. Doc tells me that it kicks in after about 2 weeks. For me it took 4 days. It felt amazing as I didn't care that much anymore and didn't take things so seriously. It felt like it was refilling something in my head and some of the saddness were gone.  It was a relief. It also reduced my anxiety. After a month at 10mg the effects were gone, so I tried 20mg. Effects of the drug is back! And now I all suddenly have a sense of humour  that I love! But the worst side effect about the drug is that it completely eliminates libido! Even when I used viagra 50mg and two 10mg cialis pills I struggled.Used it for a total of 6 months, medication stopped working, back to same old depression, so I quit  and after about 4 days my libido came back and I was just happy.Tried to change to Wellbutrin, had more side effects with that one. Doctor suggests remeron next.

I have battled with severe depression and anxiety for many years and have tried many medications. My psychiatrist recommended this escitalopram at 10 mg. Within a few days of taking it, I already felt a little uplifted. However, I had some nasty experiences that I had to work through. A side effect I had was loss of appetite and extreme fatigue. I would forget to eat or drink any water and I began having panic attacks and I went unconscious from one. The doctor said  I had panic attack and severe dehydration. So I decided to stick with the meds and to make sure I got the nutrients I needed. Now, 3 months later and I am a whole new person. Life is beautiful. I am trucking thru my first semester in college with no terrible depression or anxiety weighing me down.  And now that it is winter, I began taking vitamin D to help prevent the seasonal depression. Hope this helps anybody! I am a huge review reading fanatic and appreciate helpful reviews

Lexapro (escitalopram):Currently on day 2 - First time using antidepressants, it makes me feel so sick, I can’t stop vomiting and the just the smell of food makes me nauseous. Definitely notice my concentration is horrible within the first 2-3hours after taking the tablet. My anxiety is has heightened and I feel like it’s making me feel worse.. however will persist as my doctor has advised for the whole 2 weeks.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Lexapro didn't work for me at all but I was also on risperdal and invega sustenna at the time. Lexapro is an SSRI which supposedly adds serotonin to your brain so it might help for some people but didn't work for me because of other meds.

I did not personally have a good experience on this escitalopram, I became delusional and began having hallucinations that I was a bird and had the ability to fly. Overall not a positive experience for me.

I am a recovering drug addict and alcoholic. I experienced depression (crying, fetal position in bed, suicidal thoughts, no desire to do anything) when I stopped self medicating. Escitalopram has been effective helping me get over the hump for about 9 months. I also exercise every day, visit a therapist, and go to recovery meetings every day. It’s been difficult adjusting to the fact that sometimes I can’t climax during intercourse with my wife. She took it personal when it first began. I forgot to take it one weekend and the side effects debilitated me. It felt like lightning bolts going through my brain combined with ringing of the ears and squinting of my eyes.  9 months have gone by and I now experience the lighting bolts every morning, sweat profusely, and overreact to minor situations. The side effects are outweighing the benefit and I know the longer I take, what was only supposed to be a temporary Rx, the harder and more painful it’s going to be to stop taking it.

Lexapro (escitalopram):My experience unfortunately was very unsettling. The first few days was okay, although I instantly noticed a decrease in concentration. Then I started to notice my depression becoming worse, and anxiety went through the roof. I started to become consumed by negative thoughts and couldn’t seem to come down for being angry or sad about some things I couldn’t even pinpoint. I thought maybe I could handle it for a week, but then as symptoms increased decided I had had enough because it started to interfere with my relationship and made certain feelings I had more exaggerated and uncontrollable. I instantly called my physiatrist and I was told to ease off the medication. It’s been about a week and I thought I was OK but had another break down last night over something minuscule and reacted in a way I normally wouldn’t. The ability to bring yourself out of depression or consumed negative thoughts on this product is impossible.
Lexapro (escitalopram):Made me feel ok but gave me awful insomnia. I quit using it after just 3 days.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Was prescribed Lexapro 10mg daily for severe depression. Within an hour after taking it I felt incredibly drowsy and proceeded to fall into a fake sleep-not sleeping yet not quite awake. The next 24 hours was pure nightmare. Insomnia, severe nausea, brain fog, shaking, dizziness, headache, stomach ache. I also felt an increase in anxiety and paranoia and kept telling my husband I felt sick and that something bad was going to happen. All this after only ONE 10 mg dose! This stuff is toxic. Never again.
Very good page

Lexapro (escitalopram):I am on my 3rd day. I called Dr today thinking I wanted to stop the first 2 days were not good. I felt like I had flu. I still am not sleeping but she said stay on it give it at least 2 weeks. All of a sudden I took a turn and think it truly is working   I will stay in touch

I ended up in the ER because I was suicidal and sleeping 18 hours a day on average while on escitalopram. It was awful. Later we found out it was because my metabolism sucks, thanks to having bad genes so I  can't exactly give it a 1 because it probably works for most people...

Unfortunately escitalopram didn’t work my depression from the very start. I finished the 30 day supply hoping the side effects would taper off but they didn’t. I experienced EXTREME drowsiness, very noticeable hand shakes & restless legs. I’d get woken up by these very loud brain zaps. I’d  hear sounds like my front door or kitchen cabinets being slammed shut. I’d hear someone call my name and I’d wake up to go check on the noises but soon realized they were all in my head (auditory hallucinations). I was doing an externship at an urgent care clinic as a medical assistant and due to my hand shaking so much I was unable to draw blood or give injections. I would struggle to keep my eyes open at all times, such as when the doctor would be explaining something to me or during an observation with a patient.  I feel my anxiety was made worse because I was embarrassed & self conscious at how the side effects had total control over me and nothing I did lessened the effects.

Lexapro (escitalopram):This drug is terrible. Does not help depression. Causes depression. Worsens depression. Can cause really dark thoughts, feelings and more. Doesn't do anything helpful. Makes things worse. Do not take!

I've been on 10mg Lexapro for almost 2 weeks. Had tried 3 other meds with no relief. This trial has been going on for the past 2 years.  I don’t feel a huge difference yet at this point even though I read that it might take 2 to 4 weeks to kick in. My sleep is not the best either I wake up 3 to 4 times a night. Like go see my doctor tomorrow so I will see what she recommends at this point. I read all the positive comments about hanging in there which I’m doing but I sure wish and hope this is the med for me. Depression runs in my family, my dad committed suicide and 2 of my brothers suffer as well but are on meds. I never thought I would need to be on anything but I went through multiple stressful events, relationship ended after 20 years, death of mother, dog died, lack of sleep and retirement. I could use some words of encouragement. I’m hanging in there but still have crying spells. Thanks for listening.

I've been using Lexapro for about 7 months now. I'm definitely in a better place than when I started, but I've noticed weight gain, and my depression has slowly been creeping back into my life. Maybe I need a higher dose (currently on 10mg)? For most people with depression, I think it's worth a shot.
Lexapro (escitalopram):Lexapro is definitely the one for me

Lexapro (escitalopram):I don’t want to get into detail with my experience. I read so many positive comments about this drug . All I can say if you plan to be on this drug your whole life then ok . But when it’s time to get off you will have the worst withdrawals for over 6 months easy , anger , suicide thoughts, deeper depression then when you first started. Can’t work can’t have sex everything stopped working . I took it for 15 years this has been roughest year by far mentally from getting off this drug . Been taking natural vitamins.... I’m just a person that trusted my dr to help me feel better and it did.  But  they can’t help you when it’s time to get off they will just put u on something else. Long term damage . I can relate to all of you going thru this . And the longer you take it the harder it will be to get off.  I've been off it for about 6 months after 15 years I’m still working to get better everyday is hard . Just sharing my opinion

Lexapro (escitalopram):Lexapro was OK for me, it helped with depression but it did nothing for my anxiety. I was on 20mg and the doctor wanted to up it to 30mg., unfortunately, I said no and now I'm depressed again. The real reason I quit because of vivid, scary dreams that I get from taking Lexapro. I tried Prozac, Effexor, and it didn't work. Now I'm thinking about trying Paxil because it helped with depression and anxiety in the past, but I'm afraid my body and has gotten accustomed to Paxil which may require a higher dose. The doctor suggested Cymbalta but I hate SNRIs.

I was prescribed escitalopram for depression and anxiety.  I have only taken it for 2 days but never will to take it again. It's  so strong, my ears are ringing constantly,  my muscles are tense, my hands lost circulation while I slept. Restless sleep, nauseous all the time. Ick! Never again....

I have never actually commented on a thread ever, but I feel I have to in this case.  Lexapro has literally saved my life, my ability not only to work but thrive professionally, my ability to be a much better mom for my kids and my husband and I went from arguing daily to rarely ever.  It’s like I view the world through a different lens.  I can’t believe how well it works.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Started using Lexapro 5mg and it only worked for a short time. Same with 10mg. Once I got to 20mg a day, it started providing me consistent relief for depression and generalized anxiety disorder. Feeling great daily now. Zero side effects. 10/10

Lexapro (escitalopram):This medicine literally changed my life. I had paralyzing anxiety about getting a new job and about my relationship. I was also so depressed that I couldn't get out of bed, didn't want to meet or make new friends and literally called in sick to work some days because I was so sad. My boyfriend and I ended up breaking up and I was so devastated with that along with everything else that I was prescribed to Lexapro 10mg. After about 1 week I could feel the difference, and in about 2 months it was like a dark cloud was completely lifted away from my head. I am the happiest I've ever been and I'm no longer anxious or worried about the future. I don't know if I would have survived my break up and all of my other worried/negative thoughts if it weren't for this medication.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I suffered from constant level of anxiety since adolescence. In addition, my family life in childhood was a little turbulent.  Later in life, after starting my own family and working hard in my career, depression slowly creeped in. I felt a constant feeling of despair. This went on for years as I still functioned to provide for my family. I slowly stopped doing the things I loved dearly such as fishing. I then realized through steady  therapy and meditation for over a year that I still couldnt get rid of the despair feeling in my gut. This mental and physical feeling could not be eliminated. This result proved to me that what I was experiencing was not from my childhood, but it was my DNA. I was an anxious person with an increasing depression problem my entire life. I decided that I should try Lexapro. My doctor prescribed 5mg. I've been on the 5mg for 6 weeks. I actually started to feel true happiness again. I started fishing again.

I used to deal with panic attacks, GAD, OCD, and major depression. Health anxiety made me afraid there was something more wrong with me and made me afraid of medication. My depression got to a point that it was damaging my relationships, and therapy just wasn't enough, so I took a leap of faith and started escitalopram. No more panic attacks while driving alone or in crowded places. I genuinely enjoy things that used to stress me out now. I love to cook again. It's easier to keep the house tidy. I don't get overwhelmed anymore, even by really stressful things. :) I feel like I have more of myself to share with others, and that's a really good feeling. My constant mind chatter has quieted down. My PMS is a lot better too!I had a bit of euphoria the first week and lots of energy that made it hard to sleep. That went away and now I feel great except for some minor side effects - clenching teeth, mild tiredness, and very realistic dreams. The good weighs out the bad by a long shot. <3

Lexapro (escitalopram):After 27 years as I police officer I retired. I have PTSD. The one shooting I was involved in, the dead bodies and  all the other LE activities  that comes with the job left me paranoid. I kept dreaming about more shooting, fighting in my sleep, EXTREME anger issues and of trusted  with anyone wearing all black. After five weeks on Lexapro everything changed for the best. My family and I get alone much better. I’m no longer jumping and fighting in my sleep and I’m learning that just because people are wearing all black they are not committing a crime. The downside I’m not as interested in things like I use to be. My sex drive has went down and I do have a  I don’t care attitude. My wife wants me to stop taking Lexapro, because she said I’m too quiet. I want to stay on it because it feels good not to be angry all the time.

Lexapro (escitalopram):First off you have to realize that every drug is different for every person. It is so easy to come on here and read the negative reviews and get discouraged. I got really depressed. I went to my doctor and he prescribed 20 mg lexapro. Side effects, tired and hungry. It did not work right away. After taking it for a week it made me stop crying every day. After 2 months I was starting to get the benefits from it. I knew I needed to go down in dose only because of how tired it made me. Sooo I did it the correct way. I broke my 20 mg in half and took 10. It takes your body a  good couple weeks to get used to taking the 10mg. My body wanted the 20mg again but I held off and gave it time. After a month of 10mg I went down to 5mg. The same thing my body said oh no but I hung in there. I will stay on 5mg for a while and I am more than ok with that.  I do have bad days, we all do meds or not. us who suffer from Anxiety or Depression -we have PTSD we don't ever want to be at our worst ever again.

Second time of taking escitaloprám and  after a month the side effects are slowly going away. It helps me massively with my depression and anxiety but I do have to ride out the initial feelings and physical things like sweating, dizziness, nausea which I know will pass. Coming off isn't much either but the bits in between are worth it for me. No pain no gain I guess. Not all drugs will work for everyone so I'd say give it a go and see if you can handle the side effects but if you can't get back to the Doctors and see if you can take something else. In my support group we all take different meds for the same things so it just shows how some drugs agree with some people and some don't. Keep fighting and keep talking. God bless.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I started lexapro about two years ago after having a horrible panic attack from smoking marijuana and being too high I guess, after that night I kept having panic attacks I thought I was going to die my heart was coming out my chest and shakiness. I was diagnosed with GAD and panic disorder. I was put on 10mg lexapro and 0.5mg of klonopin short term until the lexapro kicked in. Long story short I upped the Lexapro dose to 20mg and got off the klonopin and let me tell you, this was the game changer. I have been off lexapro and every time I get back to it I work my way up to 20mg and it’s the LIFESAVER. My advice is if you’re experiencing side effects from the medication like increased anxiety etc hang in there and work with your prescribed in increasing the dose if needed, 20mg is the magical pill. I hope this helps and I can help anyone in need you’re not alone in this and you can fight depression. Trust me on this!

Lexapro (escitalopram):Lexapro has changed my life. I was reluctant to try a drug because in the past Zoloft and Paxil gave me headaches and made me feel foggy. I confess lexapro made me feel that way for the first two weeks, and then it was like I took sunglasses off and saw the world more clearly. It’s like I was living in a fog before. I have way more energy, feel happier and think more clearly. My only regret was not starting this sooner.
it is not working to me, it is really the worst medicine.  I take 20 mg but I am always sad

The generic escitalopram  for me is NOT the same as Lexapro!  Read close there is one ingredient that is not in the genetic and if it is it is not the same amount. Lexapro dose lasts for 32 hrs and this generic lasts for 27 hrs.  This generic does not hit the cells the same as Lexapro.  THIS IS NOT THE SAME! As a caregiver for someone on Lexapro I have seen first hand this genetic fail and my patient has ended up in the mental health hospital twice. If you are told this is the same as Lexapro it is not true

I had just given birth a few weeks ago and I had fell into a depression. I was diagnosed before I was pregnant with severe depression, anxiety and OCD. I was on Sertraline before I was pregnant, had to stop taking while pregnant but I did feel fine. Because I’m nursing they suggested escitalopram instead. I was told it takes 2-4 weeks to work, but I noticed a difference since day 1, and I’m only at 5mg! It also helps me shut off my brain at night. So I get sleepy after taking it.

Escitalopram is the best SSRI. It is smooth, no side effects with exception  of fatigue but that lasted 5 days.  Other ones I have tried in the past are zoloft=insomnia, prozac=too energizing, effexor=anger, cymbalta=lazy ,mirtazapine= groggy.  Escitalopram calms you without being lazy or sleepy.  You can sleep and wake up normally. No stomach or diet issues. Best of luck to all

Lexapro (escitalopram):I have depression and anxiety with OCD. I was on lexapro for a year. I didn't notice much in terms of lessening my depression. I was much more tired and I still had loss of interest in my usual activities. I also gained about 28 lbs during the year while on this medicine. All I wanted to do was sleeeeeep, I never could get enough. I combatted the leftover anxiety with my as-needed benzos. I was on 20mg Lexapro. The pills also gave me heartburn.I'm now on Prozac awaiting to see if there's a difference. It's worked for me in the past, so here's to hoping!

(Escitalopram Teva)Suffered with extreme depression on and off since I was 14 (25 now) until it started to be more on than off. Started with 5mg for 7 days then 10mg for a month.With my regular  brand Escitalopram my sex drive was evaportated and erections were hard to obtain and maintain, orgasm would take upwards of 50 minutes.With Escitalopram Teva, the change in my life has been overwhelming, I can get out of bed and shower and feed myself, I don't fear leaving the house, I'm laughing and joking again how I used to when not in a depression. I can go and get a coffee with a friend and not stress about the most ridiculous things, I'm no longer reclusive, and there has been no effect on my sex drive.My only side effects are a dry mouth, and sometimes a light headache.

So I rated cipralex a couple of days ago saying I hated it but it turns out after being extremely anxious, throwing up and waking up constantly in the middle of the night panicking I’m much calmer than I used to be and I stopped being overly sensitive and crying for no reason. I think I have more control over my emotions and it’s easier for me to enjoy things now. Intense side effects but rather great result.
No working thats all

Just when I thought I would never find an antidepressant, that was going to help with my depression/anxiety, and OCD, Lexapro saved my life. I cannot say enough about this amazing medication. I have been taking it for five years now, and do not think I will ever want to stop taking it. If I did, I would be right back to the way I was before.
Lexapro (escitalopram):I started on Lexapro and it made me feel very zombie like

I’ve been taking 5mg  cipralex brand of escitalopram for 11 days now and I’ve already had a really intense panic attack and most of the time I just wake up in the middle of the night and have a hard time falling back asleep. I threw up twice and I feel dizzy every time I get up. I’m much more anxious than I was before and I hope these side effects won’t last any longer.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I have been on Lexapro since January (so 9 months now) and my life has really changed. I was officially diagnosed with generalized anxiety and unspecified depression, and was having panic attacks daily. Not to mention I was only sleeping about 2 hours in the morning and crying for pretty much every little thing. My condition worsened during the winter, so I finally agreed to start medication. After a few weeks, I felt like a new person! I’m far less emotional, I sleep better, and I haven’t had a panic episode since starting the medication! Then again, I was also prescribed xanax whenever I feel super anxious. I wouldn’t think of ever switching to a different antidepressant.
I just started on 2.5 mg this past week. I take it at night as the doc recommended. I had tried Prozac, Zoloft and bupropion with no success.  Isn’t 2.5 mg too low of a dose.
Lexapro (escitalopram):My daughter took this for a few days and got to a real dark place in her mind, which she wasn’t before

Was taking 10 mg for about 10 years for depression. Worked so well I forgot what it felt like to be depressed. Initially it made me nauseous & spiked my anxiety levels so I split to 1.25 mg and worked my way up. Took time but worked like a charm without any side-effects. There was increased sedation but that subsided in a month or two. The sexual dysfunction actually helped my premature ejaculation problem.By 10th year it started showing signs of pooping out so decided to taper and stop. Then suddenly WHAM!! the withdrawal hit me hard and the depression and anxiety came back with a mighty vengance . Getting back on the drug had no effect. Now I'm on mirtazapine and feeling much better.I must confess however, the decrease in efficacy of escitalopram could be linked to my alcohol abuse at that time. Else maybe it would have worked for couple more years.

I’ve been taking escitalopram for the past 4 months for my major depressive disorder. Honestly I tried many before and was close to giving up. I am now taking 20mg escitalopram. I noticed just the first week of taking this drug I was laughing more, more pleasant to be around and arguing with loved ones much less. I don’t know if anyone has had a similar experience to me but I am someone who doesn’t typically cry much. However, on this drug I feel everything my depression has forced me to suppress for so long. I am now a crier in all appointments and it has helped me to better communicate my emotions to others. However crying can be an awkward and shaming experience for someone it hasn’t been this for me. I feel better after and it’s helped along with my therapy. I’d say even if I was taking this medication alone I would still need counselling alongside to discuss everything the medication has forced me to feel.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I have depression for as long as I can remember but anxiety only started about 3 years now. I’ve tried antidepressants in the past and hated the side effects so I stopped it all together until recently when my psychiatrist said I should try Lexapro. I’ve been on it for 2 weeks and the side effects Is in the extremities for me. Migraines, nauseous, loud ringing in ears, fatigue, lack of sleep, blurred vision, dizziness . Pretty much as horribly as you can imagine BUT after the first week I stopped being paranoid. I could take a shower without thinking I’m going to drown. It’s all mental issues that I ignored for a long time which eventually turned into something out of my control.  After 2 weeks on Lexapro I could honestly say it’s helping me. I don’t expect it to cure or fix my problem but I know it will help me manage my thoughts /thinking and help me get control of my emotions which will eventually make me understand what I’mDoing wrong in life so I can fix it myself

Am on my 7th week on escitalopram. 1st 4 weeks on 10mg. Doctor increased me to 15mg for my depression. Seems first two weeks on 15mg was like starting all over . Anxiety and still depression. I guess I need to stick it out for the 8 weeks or more to kick in. Came this far. Not quitting now. Anybody experience same symptoms. Thanks. Mike.

I started taking SSRIs for anxiety, depression, and OCD. Lexapro was kinda harsh when I first started given I was weening myself off of another SSRI (Prozac) but once I got to 10 mg I started to feel a lot better. My physician upped my does to 20 mg and it’s honestly not been great so far, I guess I need time for my body to process the medicine but it’s also a lesson that sometimes lower dosages sometimes work better than higher ones in my experience. Overall, I think Lexapro has definitely been helping me and it’s also a testament to the importance of patience, so if you are struggling don’t quit, give yourself a month and then try a different SSRI or other forms of antidepressants/anti anxiety medication.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Started on Lexapro 10mg 2 years ago for anxiety. First 6 weeks were very difficult with erectile dysfunction, insomnia, constantly tired & not being able to focus at work. I nearly stopped medication several times as was really messing me about. After 6 weeks most of the side effects eased and anxiety management was improved. Earlier this year had an upheaval in my relationship & was very depressed. My psychologist recommended trying a higher dosage of Lexapro and Doctor agreed to increase to 20mg.  Unfortunately the side effects experienced two years ago returned. Took 4 weeks for the side effects to ease & both anxiety and depression are now manageable.  Still seeing my psychologist as just important as the medication for me to ensure I have the right support structure in place. I currently am in the best place mentally I’ve been for several years and Lexapro has definitely helped in my case. Glad I persevered through the initial side effects as the change has been positive.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I am on three different meds for blood pressure. The culprit to my depression is propranolol and the doctor even said that. I tried coming off of it and my heart was pounding thru my chest. Went back on it and he gave me lexapro 5 mg to help the propranolol induced depression. I have not taken it because of all the horror stories I see from it. I’d rather deal with the depression than have something else add another problem. The common theme here is one drug after another and all they the doctors want to do is add more meds to you. No thanks and I wish everyone only the best if your taking this poison. Honestly I’d rather have high blood pressure than role the dice with depression and lexapro

Lexapro (escitalopram):My doctor prescribed me Lexapro and I left so good and motivated. Then I thought of trying other anti depressants to feel more better. I tried Prozac, Zoloft, Effexor XR, Desvenlafexine but none gave the best result as Lexapro.It was life changing experience. I will never change from Lexapro.

My recent depressive episode began about 12 months ago and I was ready to take my own life. My dr prescribed Escitalopram 20mg. The first 2 weeks I was mildly nauseous, tired but couldn’t sleep, dizzy, foggy brain. This quickly passed though. I am on week 5. I actually feel happy again, I’m laughing, engaging with people, coping with my job, not worrying incessantly and feel calm. I sleep so well, straight through the night and wake feeling refreshed, something I haven’t experienced in years. I have more energy. I actually started exercising again! The first 2 weeks are hard, side effects were rough, but see it through, it’s worth it. I was terrified of weight gain and I’ve not gained at all, no appetite changes. Depression lifted, anxiety...what anxiety. I feel like I’m living again. Please give this drug a chance to work, get through the side effects and you’ll be fine. I hope this helps someone.

I was on it for 3 months. Quit almost 3 years ago and I still don’t feel like myself. I had terrible side effects, headache, dizziness, and it affected my libido horribly. Still don’t have my libido back. Hoping my brain goes back to normal. I also can’t even get a nicotine buzz which is horrible.

I was suicidal I had it all planned out, My doctor gave me escitalopram, I decided to stick it out hoping it might work, one last hope.  And day 9 it kicked in and I wanted to live again, and I have gotten better every day since. This little pill saved my life. Literally. It even helped alleviate some of my nerve pain.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I was on lexapro for several years for depression, the entire time I was on it I was unable to orgasm. No matter how much or how long I did it for, nothing would happen. I spoke several times to my doctor and her nurse practitioner about the issue and they just gave me ED medication, which was not the issue at all. Eventually I asked to be taken off it because that was worse than the depression. Eventually everything went back to normal.
It took this over a few weeks but I could not leave my house on this medication. Had zero interest in doing anything besides sleep and eat.

I was prescribed 20 mg of Lexapro and I stayed on it for about a month and a half. It was for depression and GAD, and I started my first two weeks on a 10mg dose.  The first day I felt normal,  but the next two or three had me feeling absolutely whack. I felt somewhat euphoric *slightly* and energetic and anything I thought ended up coming out of my mouth - no filter. The next few days I started to feel exhausted, and I would sleep as soon as I got home.  Then about five or six days in I started having HORRIBLE panic attacks in the middle of my classes, and I kept sobbing like 2/3 times a day. I felt super super suicidal and I felt apathetic towards my friends and family. I started just sleeping all the time, and almost failed my exams due to the loss of motivation and how the pills made me feel. I'd basically wake up, stare at the wall, cry, sleep.

Lexapro (escitalopram):It’s been 2 weeks since I started titrating down Effexor and taking Lexapro. Two super hard weeks and getting worse. Anxiety through the roof. Depression bad. Can’t focus. Can’t sit still. Waiting to hear from doc but did take an Effexor yesterday and one today again (will take 1/2 Lexapro tonight while wait to hear from doc tomorrow). I was depressed on Effexor but at least I could function. Couldn’t function on Lexapro alone. Don’t know whether will try another new antidepressant or not. Maybe stick with Effexor and pray I can get better on it in time.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I've been on Lexapro 10 MG for four months to treat depression and PTSD. Anxiety and depression have significantly improved. The adjustment period was challenging. For the first 2 weeks, I felt like my depression was gone. During the next 3 weeks I felt lethargic with low motivation. After 1.5 months I thought the medicine was no longer working, as my depression worsened. My psychiatrist upped the dosage to 15 MG. At 15 MG, I had fatigue, nausea, headaches, and slept 13-hour nights. I went back to 10 MG, and the negative side effects ceased. After 4 months, I think Lexapro is effective. I don't have inner negative chatter and don't feel like my brain is shutting off from being tired. I feel happier and more confident. I have improved motivation to go to work, exercise, and socialize. I feel more relaxed. No weight gain and SI is gone. Some days my brain is foggy. Depression still comes one week prior to my menstrual cycle. I'd say try to get through the adjustment period. Good luck!

Lexapro (escitalopram):SO BAD. I was taking Zoloft for like 2 years and then I suddenly stopped taking it so the depression worsen and they wanted to try something new and they gave me this. I also suffer from anxiety attacks and this is the first day taking it (10mg) and I’ve never felt this bad before. I honestly rather feel depressed than continue this drug. They told me to try it for 3 weeks and I honestly can’t take this pill one more time. I feel so disconnected, numb and I can’t concentrate AT ALL and I for sure can’t drive on this pill. Zoloft didn’t feel this bad, I regret trying this

Lexapro (escitalopram):I had to go on this about 8 years ago, the standard 10mg for insanely bad OCD, depression and anxiety. The first time I took it I felt much better within two weeks. Two years later I tapered off it very slow. Usually 2.5 mg lower each month for 4 months. Recently I have not been able to control my depression and with current stresses I dropped so low again. I’ve now been back on Lexapro for 3 weeks, after two weeks you notice a bit or a difference. Mostly a numbing feeling over all your emotions. Currently I still feel the depression and the anxiety is awful in the morning so I’m going to try 15 mg and see how that goes. I’ve noticed when I drink Yerba Mate my anxiety gets much worse so I’m going to remove all caffeine for a while. Hang in there buds, I know how awful our minds treat us. Try and walk or jog as much as you can and eat as healthy as possible. I’m not saying that in a judgey way but it helps. Talk as much as you can and know it will get better.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I take it for post partum depression, It really helps but makes you tired. I take it at bedtime. There are sexual side effects! Helps with worrying but I am  also losing hair like crazy! I don't know if it's from having twins though???

Lexapro (escitalopram):Absolutely horrible. This drug makes you a person you aren’t. I was on this for 3 months and weaned off it 2 months ago. Still don’t feel like myself after not taking it for 2 months. Absolutely horrible.

Lexapro (escitalopram):After having a stressful job and coming to a job less stressful, I had a few months of struggle with anxiety and depression.  I finally came to a breaking point when I literally couldn't sleep at night and was running on 2 hours of sleep every night.  I went to my doc who prescribed me Lexapro which I was hesitant to take.  I finally gave in and just took it.  the first few days to a week were tough but after the first week, I started to feel the cloud lifting.  This is week 6 of taking the medicine and feel INCREDIBLE! I even feel more confident and anxiety has decreased so much! I am so thankful to my doctor for sticking with me and not giving up on me!

Lexapro (escitalopram):Took away anxiety and depression but also took away all emotions. Was a zombie for years and made me feel sick almost every day. Coming off it was the worst in terms of the brain zaps and nausea. Would absolutely not recommend

Lexapro (escitalopram):I was on Zoloft for 27 years. One day I was driving and had  dread come over me I thought I was dying. I checked myself into the local ER and discovered that it was my Zoloft which worked well for many years. I was desperate, a friend I work with wrote me a RX. for Lexapro. After three days on 10mg I could feel the change for the better. I cut myself to 5mg after a couple of months and feel really good, am able to focus at work I sleep very well at night. One benefit is I lost 27 pounds and I needed to. So now I feel better both physically and mentally. Thanks Lexapro.

I’m 18 and I started taking Lexapro my sophomore year of high school. I wish 15 year old me could have read this. I remember being in school unable to concentrate, overthinking, and crying in the bathroom stalls. When I was first put on medicine, I felt no change. I wanted so badly just to be me again that I didn’t give it time and went straight to the internet to see if it gets better. It does!!! Maybe Lexapro isn’t the medicine for you, but give it time. I am so happy now. Yes I know you feel all tingly and weird at first, but stick it out for a little bit and TALK to someone. So many people will have shared experiences. Trust me it helps so much to talk to ANYONE about how you’re feeling. It gets better, man. Take a deep breath and you will be able to control the depression with help

I was put on this for quite bad depression.Started with 10mg and the first 2 days I did experience "brain zaps" and nausea, as well as very limited sleep but by day 4 I was back to normal AND HAPPY.I was amazed how quickly my depression symptoms vanished. My whole outlook on life turned positive. This tablet literally saved my life. I took this whilst seeing a Psychologist, I recommend doing both hand in hand for a bit until you feel ready to tackle things alone.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I am a 50 year old mother who was depressed. I cried constantly and was miserable to be around - I couldn't even remember how to laugh. My doctor prescribed 10 mg escitalopram. I was so eager to feel better that I took the first pill in the middle of the day. Within 2 hours, I had heart palpitations, was shaking, couldn't focus, and was very dizzy. I was sure I was going to die. I spent my day googling "Lexapro Side Effects" which said the side effects would lessen in 2 weeks. My doctor suggested a half pill, but within 4 days, I went back to 10 mg since I was eager to feel better. The side effects continued but lessened. I can't say that most of them were gone in less than 3 weeks, and even now, I still get some flushing in my chest (at 8-1/2 weeks). I would have quit, but at the same time, I found myself singing along with songs on the radio and even laughed. My crying bouts became less frequent. For now am content to relearn how to enjoy life and am happy I persevered.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I started on Lexapro for depression for 5mg then went up to 10mg after two weeks. All it did was make me more depressed  than I already was that I had to go off it. Then I started taking 10mg. I have been on it for almost 2 months now and it has had literally no effect on me. Still feel very depressed even though it has been in combination with therapy and I even changed my life conditions. I'm going to keep taking it for 2 more months and will update then.

I had an issue with some of the side effects of escitalopram for awhile. Mostly the weird stomach feeling, increased sleep and appetite. After the 3rd week, I started feeling a bit better in the brain, and the side effects went down. After 6 weeks, all I can say is this medicine is a Game Changer for me! What I noticed most is how I'm no longer stuck in my head, thinking or worrying. Things that would have bothered me or worried me no longer did. I was also reading some CBT self help books, which also helped motivate me to get my brain healthy again. While most SSRI's aren't for everybody, I will say if you can get passed some of the minor side effects, this medicine is fantastic for reversing the effects of depression/anxiety.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I've been on lexapro for about 4 months. It is good for my issue but I have developed another issue, my sex drive has gone down a lot and  my lady sometimes feels like it's her and it's not.  I never used to be that way but it is not fair to her, I have to get my sex drive back. I mean the medicine works I mean and  I have become a completely  different  person for the better. That  is but I may to change meds

Lexapro (escitalopram):Previously I was on celexa for three years, my Doc tapered me off while adding Lexapro. I've been on it for two weeks  at 15mg, my anxiety is gone my depression, seem no existing. I have lots of energy, I feel like my old self. Side effects my stomach growls a lot.

Tried escitalopram for GAD and MDD (have been on Effexor, Zoloft, remeron, Wellbutrin, Paxil, abilify and seroquel previously). Had really high hopes for it as I’ve heard other people do so well on it. Did okay for the first 2 ish days - some dizziness and loss of appetite then developed horrible restless leg syndrome :( overall the med did make me feel a bit better and elevated my mood but the RLS is not worth it as I have constant twitching and can’t sit still and have had to increase my doses of diazepam to help. I would still recommend this med to anyone suffering with GAD as I think RLS is a rare side effect.

I am 43 and for first time in my life I had a severe mental crisis. The doctor put me on 10mg escitalopram. I took it at night, slept for the first time in years, woke up in the morning and felt like I had my life back. I couldn’t believe it. I actually had feelings again. I was at the point where when any of my children walked in a room I would loose it. I would get angry for no reason. That morning when they came down a rush of pure love for my children returned. I actually wanted to be close to people and didn’t have to just endure hugs, etc. my husband was so happy to have affection from me again. This lasted about 10 to 14 days. This past week I happened to be done with school and had the week off work. I slept the entire time the kids were at school. I slept all night. I can barely bring myself to do anything. I wore the same clothes for days. I have an appointment this coming week and I hope to find a solution.

This generic of Lexapro really is a bad drug I need brand name Lexapro I just got approved for a brand the generic did Ameal pharms it made my condition worse now I’m going to look up the manufacture and what country and where it came from. United States government should be aware of this some generics are OK but this generic  this generic of Lexapro really is a bad drug I need brand name Lexapro I just got approved for a brand the generic did Amneal pharms it made my condition worse now I’m going to look up the manufacture and what country and where it came from. United States government should be aware of this some generics are OK but this generic ESCITALOPRAM   Is very bad for my condition therefore I no longer take the generic form of Lexapro it made my condition worse. I am just thankful  for my doctor that understands this but our government is trying to give you Garbage.

A remarkable med, helping my menopausal depression/anxiety, but REALLY challenging first fortnight. Previously I couldn’t sleep/see people/leave the house. After 5mg escitalopram the difference is astounding. I’m relaxed, sociable, confident, without feeling depersonalised (which I did when taking citalopram for 7 wks last year). No side-effects from escitalopram now. However, the initial 13 days were challenging. V sleepy (pill at 8am), anxious/jittery. On days 8-13 I felt more depressed and cried constantly, questioning how a drug could make me feel worse. My jaw was clamping and appetite zero. Sleep improved tho. Suddenly, on days 14 and 15, I felt calm, smiling genuinely for the first time in weeks. 100% authentically me. Not drugged, depressed, over-excitable or anxious. I’ve returned to work and socialise. Jaw-clamping gone and appetite back. Slight impact on libido. PLEASE TRY THIS DRUG, but prep for potentially difficult early weeks. I now have my life back.

Overall I am quite pleased with the escitalopram working to improve my quality of life from depression. Essentially I suffered with what I believed was simply chronic insomnia. It all came to a head, when at 50 years of age, I was let go from my job due to poor performance. I was isolating myself at home, had no patience with my family, and started drinking more than I should. After an extensive conversation with my PCP, he diagnosed me with depression and generalized anxiety. Quite a blow. Escitalopram at 10 mg  dose has given me back myself, it has worked for the depression and anxiety. I’m at a new job, looking forward to each day. I’m a better husband, father, son, brother and friend. I no longer see the glass as half empty; I just see a glass with water in it. I’m at about 60 days in; For how long it took for the escitalopram to start working - I’d say my sleep improved around 3 weeks, and with my depression I began to feel better closer to four weeks. No significant sides effects. I don’t like the idea of a chronic med, but I now understand that the insomnia was merely the symptom of what was chronic depression and anxiety.
Lexapro (escitalopram):It just been 2 days since I start take it so I don't know if it help but only thing is that I feel like my skin is on fire. And my thought  is running more.
It  has just been 2 days since I started  taking it so I don't know if it helps but only thing is that I feel like my skin is on fire. And my thoughts  are running more.

Was diagnosed with major depressive disorder (MDD)  at age 40.  It had hit hard and fast out of blue. 3 months of awfulness trying to figure out what was wrong with me. The escitalopram took 3-4 weeks to set in and start working and it lasted 9 good years with zero depression. Then recently something triggered my anxiety and boom within a month back in the bottomless pit.

I started Escitalopram (Lexapro generic) 5mg three months ago to help me with depression and anxiety (I've been on Lorazepam for anxiety for a few years). Both of my parents became sick at the same time, and I was their caregiver for more than 3 years. They died within months of each other, and I was devastated. I had never been depressed before, but depression came roaring into my life after they died. I was resistant to trying an anti-depressant, but after many months of crying and increased anxiety (with some panic thrown in for good measure), I relented and tried the Escitalopram. No real side effects other than a little diarrhea for the first few days, and it does help me sleep better. I take it at 2pm each day. No need to increase the dose as far as I can tell as I am no longer crying daily (or even weekly), and I feel lighter in my heart.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I’ve been on 5mg lexapro for three months now  actually for bipolar disorder and WOW I feel so different from when I first started. Anxiety and depression is under control for the most part and no more crazy dissociation and ruminating thoughts. The first week taking Lexapro is usually the worst week in terms of side effects, as I was nauseous, restless, agitated, and irritated. I did experience brain zaps too, but the side effects did go away after the first week. I also sometimes experience blunted affect from taking this medication, but for the most part I do finally feel like my normal self again.

Lexapro (escitalopram):It helped me take away my PTSD spirals and panic attacks -sometimes.  I’m disappointed, but I’m more disappointed my doctor didn’t recognize my stomach issues as a side effect. For years I’ve been on Lexapro and I’ve been tired all the time, depressed, and it honestly made it worse. Finally got off after coming clean to everyone about my dark thoughts that are my PTSD/ shame I’ve hidden because I didn’t think my childhood sexual trauma would be the cause? I’m not disappointed in the drug but the way we use it. I had to feel the hard feelings and the drug was in the way. I hope others find it helpful.

Lexapro at 20mg made me incredibly anxious when I took it at night, like more anxious than I have ever been. I was full on shaking. That’s the biggest side effect for me, full-body shaking. I am super stressed out in my everyday life and this medicine is not helping my anxiety, however it helps with my depression. Don’t smoke weed right after taking Lexapro by the way, it made me shake even more and it made me incredibly self-conscious.

Looking back I realized I suffered from anxiety/ depression since I was a child. In my early teens I started self medicating with alcohol/drugs ,of course I did not realize I was doing that, or that it only made matters WORSE. In my early 30's because of high blood pressure problems I also admitted to the depression. The doctor tried a few different anti depressants. The side effects of them dry mouth, headaches, weird dreams and I had no mood improvement, so I gave up on them. Years later, after a major life crisis I tried again. Escitalopram had virtually none of the side effects I struggled with from earlier experiences and worked for my depression. I noticed a difference in my mood. After several years I decided, since the crisis was over, I felt "stable" so I asked the doctor to wean me off the medication. Within a 10 days, I asked him to remind me to NEVER let me do that again! I noticed a HUGE difference! It was a good reminder, showing me how much it really did help.
This medication made me more depressed, unmotivated, sad and just feeling flat.  Prozac worked better. Went off Lexapro.

Lexapro (escitalopram):The good side of Lexapro reduces unwanted thoughts associated with depression ie suicidal thoughts. The other side of Lexapro is it's ability to increase interest in life activities. There are more pros to Lexapro than cons. An added benefit is that it builds up your inner strength to navigate through anxiety. It also mysteriously decreases interest in sex, which is not always a bad thing. Lexapro isn't physically energizing. It's more sedating, but also not great for insomnia. The best part of Lexapro is that it works for many months maybe many years and buys you plenty of time to adjust your life to make it better. The sad part is that it's not euphoric which would be nice every once in a while.I  had a rare side effect starting Lexapro where I'd have to take OTC pain relievers because of muscle pain, but it went away after a month or two.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Worse med I’ve ever taken. I started with 20mg. The first day I felt like I was high. I was super anxious and paranoid. I was super shaky. Randomly crying. When I say crying I was sobbing I couldn’t stop. I felt tense and I couldn’t stand up because I was dizzy. I was scared to go through a door way because I felt like the room got small. I felt really suicidal, I took myself to the hospital because I didn’t feel like myself. I have major depression and this caused me to feel like I hit rock bottom. I discontinued after the first dose. Scared to try anything else.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Totally useless! Started this med at 10mg lexapro for OCD. Did not experience any relief from my symptoms til I started going to a psychologist. My psychiatrist advised me to stay on it and it was a huge mistake. Years later I suddenly became extremely depressed in spite of being on it!! Dr bumped it up to 20mg but still did nothing!! Later it was a bunch of trial and error trying different meds to finally feel better. I tried being off any medication for a while but it was very hard to sleep so having started Lexapro has essentially permanently changed things in a bad way for me! Stay away from this useless med!!! For OCD, I recommend going to a psychologist first before starting any medication.

I feel escitalopram  does the job well for my depression. The medication helps you manage stress, which, in turn, makes you inhale more oxygen, therefore, making you physically active and mentally calm at the same time. Though the side effect may vary from person to person in case the smaller dosage doesn't work you may need to increase the dose as per your body response rate. Remember to consult your doctor as he/she is best to advise per your condition.Anyone using this may experience systematic weight loss, trust your doc this will eliminate sedentary lifestyle for good.This even helps to kick procrastination (your first point of advise has to be your doctor only). This is not an advisory for weight loss.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I first started lexapro on 1/10/19 with a small dosage of 5 mg. Every 4 weeks I’d follow-up with my Dr see if an increase should be made . Current date is 3/28/19 & I’m on 20 mg. My experience with it has been wonderful .  I suffered severe depression, OCD and anxiety . Because of my depression , I’d have mood swings and everything irritated me. I started on Prozac which is wonderful for anxiety but the vivid dreams were so intense I asked to be removed from them . Now on lexapro I still dream every day but they are tolerable dreams. Depression is no joke, folks. Please keep in mind , what worked for me may not work for you and vice versa. Find something that works for you ! I thank Lexapro for making me feel normal again.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I haven't been on it for very long but at the moment I'm neutral. It's better than some stuff I've taken but it doesn't stop me from getting dangerously low moods on bad days. It's also left me feeling quite detached...

Lexapro (escitalopram):After taking lexapro for about three months I lost about 70% of my hair. My doctor did not tell this was a potential side effect and now I am even more depressed than before I started taking it. I spent six years growing out my hair until it was long and beautiful and now I look like a sick person. Not worth it.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Overall I feel much better since I’ve been taking Lexapro and that started at day three. My doc wanted me to take 10 mg and when I did I was extremely agitated so backed off to mg.  Unfortunately I haven’t been able to keep or maintain an erection and I’ve lost the ability to ejaculate Hopefully that all changes as I am only on week three.

I asked my Doctor for a mild depression medication after brain surgery.   He recommended Lexapro.  The first week I took 1/2 a 5mg pill.  Upped to a whole pill Friday.  By Saturday I was having anxiety, which I've never had before.   Now, 6 days in the anxiety won't quit, I can't sleep.   I'd rather go back to not taking it.   At .25 I did stop crying all the time.   Anyone else?

Lexapro (escitalopram):I began my search for the silver bullet with Celexa. No noticeable effect. Then Zyprexa; same thing. Then the psychiatrist tried Lexapro. Bingo!! But then not so much salutary [beneficial, good] effects after about 6 weeks. When I started on 10 mg dosage the effect was an pronounced exhilaration. I could NOT believe it and, sad to say, it lasted for no more than 5-6 days. Make a chart! Mood- It had a sudden extremely beneficial [?] effect within 24 hours, then it hit a plateau, levelled off, only to plummet within 24 hrs. I found this off-again, on-again cycle frustrating and, needless to say, difficult for family to cope with. A far better approach was to reduce alcohol and coffee, see a behavioral therapist, and play a lot more tennis.

I have MDD. I switched from Effexor to Escitopram 6 months ago. Anhedonia has been a regular and persistent feature while on this medication. I’m feeling that I need to try something different again as the anhedonia has intensified and greets me everyday when I wake up.

Lexapro (escitalopram):For someone who has suffered as long as she can remember from depression and anxiety, I can attest to the fact that Lexapro does wonders. I have never been happier or mentally stable in my entire life. I don’t have much else to tell you.

I can't rate escitalopram yet because I have only been on it for 4 days. I will revisit in a couple of weeks. I just wanted to comment on my experience with side effects. So far I may have experienced some headaches and tiredness a little more than normal. I'm overweight and out of shape so I experience that anyway. Otherwise, thankfully I have not experienced anything. I was worried after reading some of the reviews though.
Been on escitalopram for 5 1/2 weeks not showing any signs of improvement.

Lexapro (escitalopram):After enduring severe depression, anxiety, obsessive thoughts, brain fog, problems with focusing, and a sleep disorder since childhood, I went on 10 mg of Lexapro at age 40. It took 6 weeks for Lexapro to work, but my entire life changed. All of the sudden, my thoughts became clear, more positive, and I could focus.  My severe anxiety was reduced, my sleep disorder dramatically improved, and I stopped thinking about suicide. I was slightly nauseous for a few weeks. The worst side effect I had for a few years was fatigue.  I have been taking Lexapro for 15 years in doses of 10-20 mg.  I can reduce my dose during the summer months to 15 mg. I have no intention of going off the drug.

I was on Escitalopram for about 3 months , it does not works for me , just made me a little relaxed , that causes numbness feeling and it was the worst thing . I am on sertraline now and it works better

Lexapro (escitalopram):I took a lexapro 10 mg. I have never taken anything for mood swings before. I ended up having to call an ambulance and went to ER $12,000 later... my heart felt like it was going to explode.  My blood pressure is normally around 108 for the top # and it was 165. My skin was crawling my eye dilated I couldn't breath I was shaking extremely bad and I experienced nausea. It was the most terrifying experience ever. Please be careful and take a quarter of 10 mg to see how you feel. I threw them away and it has now mad me to scared to take anything again..

Lexapro (escitalopram):My best friend Brad took Lexapro for 4 weeks then commited suicide.  No outward symptoms of depression.  He was the most social person I knew.  Always happy and positive.  Left behind 2 kids and a wife because of this drug.  Stay Away!

Lexapro (escitalopram):I've been taking 5mg liquid Lexapro at night for just over two weeks. I definitely feel a huge difference in the amount of anxiety. I had no idea just how bad it was until I started taking Lexapro. I was initially prescribed Lexapro for depression. I am seeing a huge difference in my anxiety which is allowing me to function more normally. I'm only feeling a slight difference in my depression but that could also be because I'm not freaking out all of the time and because it's only been a couple of weeks. I'm so glad to get some relief and be able to have normal conversations and interact with people with out feeling like I'm floating out of my body. The best part of this is that I am not constantly agitated or quick to anger which my husband is very grateful for : )

I had a massive depressive breakdown and developed severe anxiety overnight. One thing I can say is that this medication literally saved my life. If it wasn't for escitalopram I'd probably would be dead.

I was put on this for my anxiety and depression. I took it one day and had worse anxiety and can’t sleep and had a bad anxiety attack. I can’t say this will happen to everyone but sharing my experience . Will not be taking this drug anymore

Lexapro (escitalopram):So I've been on 10mg a day since November. I truly did not feel any changes the first two weeks. After that things began to look up. I haven't experienced any weight gain or increased acne. Recently I got an IUD and have felt a little more down, but it hasn't been as intense as in the past, (I don't feel like driving into brick walls) and it could honestly just be the new hormones. Does anyone really understand young depressed sexually active females? I'm excited to see how I feel after I have ~normal~ hormones!

Lexapro (escitalopram):Lexapro has changed my lifefor the better. I first started Lexapro in September of 2018 after consulting with my MD about severe PMS symptoms including short temper and feelings of disgust towards my significant other. I never expected it to improve my day to day life. Since I've been on Lexapro, my PMS issue has been completely resolved and I'm a generally happier person. My co-workers, who don't know I've started taking Lexapro, have told me that I'm more approachable and I even got employee of the quarter! That's NEVER happened before! The only noticeable side effect I had was a decreased libido but it was short lived. With less anger and no more " divorce or death" PMS feelings, my sex life is as good if not better than ever! Medications work differently from individual to individual but, for me, Lexapro is a life saver!

Taking 10mg of Escitalopram for 12 weeks. Thought I was over side effects, but suddenly panic attacks, jaw ache, nausea. GP has prescribed Slow release Beta Blocker. When will this end?Originally diagnosed with depression.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I have been on Lexapro (20 mg) for 2 years, and prior to that I was taking Paxil (25 mg) for 6 months (25 y/o female). My personality completely changed upon taking lexapro- very apathetic, aggressive, secluded. I gained weight (20lbs) and could not drink more than 2/3 alcoholic drinks with out risking a blackout. If I didn’t take the pill for 2 days I would absolutely freak out. All I could do is cry and complain. I would sweat, shake, zap, and get nauseous/dizzy every time I moved. I decided to get off this terrible medication! I am on week 4 and it’s been three days since my last dose. I’m starting to feel bad. I cannot sleep, no appetite, I can’t focus, I feel dizzy all the time and my body temp is never comfortable. Mood swings are a big one. Distracting yourself is key!
Worst drug ever.  I've basically been chemically castrated for life from it.  I have a condition know as PSSD  (post SSRI sexual dysfunction )

Within 12 hours of taking this drug I was tripping.  Not like talking to toasters but more subtle than that.  I took first 10mg dose at 8 pm Saturday night.  Sunday about 1 I went to nearby town to return and get some new movies.  I noticed first how bright the sun was.  I turned on some tunes to exercise patience as a slow truck was ahead of me and its a windy road.  All the sudden the music wrapped me up.  My mind started in with delirious thoughts.  Well you get the point.Basically, its like this.  LSD adds serotonin to your body.  Lexapro/generic prevents serotonin from being absorbed.  Too much serotonin and guess what- you are tripping. 27 percent of people with depression may have serotonin issues, but there is no way to tell if its you. Never again for me.  I had same experience on wellbutrin 15 years ago and got so freaked out I self committed myself.  Any SSRI is dangerous stuff.  Luckily I knew what was happening this time and played a lot of pink floyd to help me get thru it.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Helped my depression a lot but tons of side effects.Couldn't even have 1 drink while on it because it felt like I was overdosing on a nervous system depressant (heaviness/pain in arms and legs/chest).ALSO kept being woken up in the middle of the night with extreme panic/heart palpitations. Felt disconnected from my body a lot too. Things I never experienced before taking lexapro. Weaned myself off it and the side effects went away. Not worth the benefits.

Lexapro (escitalopram):When I started taking Lexapro I was afraid I would feel weird, I didn't. I felt relieved that now I remembered how a smile felt. Then I thought I was better so stopped taking them which was a huge mistake. Yes there's weight gain and yes I have occasional muscle jerks but the good out weighs bad.  Back on them again and happy.

I began taking Escitalopram after moving in with my 92 year old parents, Mom had Alzheimer's.  After 1 year of medical crises, I became anxious & depressed. Crying all the time, unable to cope or sleep. So I agreed to try Lexapro.  I started off with one 10 mg/day. Some nausea but it helped almost immediately.  I slowly increased to 2 pills daily with min side effects-occasional nausea. At that time my parents were both moved into care. I began to think about weaning myself off the meds. Then my father died suddenly.  It was heartbreaking, yet I could not cry.  I understood how much the meds were affecting me. Now 6 months after that I am off them & feeling great. I was fearful of getting off them, which I did very slowly.  I noticed irritability only.  I feel my creativity coming back plus I grieve with tears for my father now but it feels healing.  I will always recommend this medication as I feel it saved my life.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Anybody experience side effects after taking Lexapro for over 2 weeks? The 1st two weeks I felt good with a couple of mild side effects. Then week 3 I started having on and off depression, jittery in the mornings, loss of appetite and some diarrhea. I will be on it 4 weeks the end of this week I'm feeling better today - just hope it continues.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I have PTSD and depression and have noticed a big change in mood swings. Much more up and less negative. Some sexual side effects at first. Now that I have been using the drug for a month the side effects seem to be gone.
Lexapro (escitalopram):Wonderful drug for depression, but not so much for OCD...

Lexapro (escitalopram):This medicine worked absolute wonders for me for about three months. After the (pretty bad) first side effects went away, I was the happiest I had literally ever been on 10 mg daily. I had energy and motivation. However, after the honeymoon period, things started deteriorating, and my doctor upped my dosage to 15 mg, and from there to the highest possible dosage, 20 mg. 15 mg felt no different from 10 mg. 20 mg made me incredibly suicidal and only increased the initial depression symptoms that first made me turn to medication as a possible answer. I am now on Prozac and so far it's been much more effective than the Lexpro and has had far fewer negative side effects.

I’ve been on escitalopram for 2 years now and I don’t know what to do anymore. My depression is still with me although I know it’s better. I'm worried about stopping cos if I feel the way I feel now (which is not what I should be feeling) how would I feel off of it!? I’ve been on many depression meds that have been bad for me. This one seems to be the best but there are many symptoms that make me want to quit. For one I’m in a 3 year relationship and have lost all sexual drive. I don’t feel turned on until I actually have to force myself to have sex. Two, I have anger issues but never have I been this angry. I throw things such as my $700 phone and things or I scratch my skin and hit my head because I feel a lot of hatred.  I’m at a loss and I’m done trying new medications. I was diagnosed with major anxiety, severe depression, insomniac, and ADHD at the age of 15. I need help.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I lost my mom when I was 24 years old 5 years later my dad passed too. I thought I was fine but I really was not. Going forward I hate that I did not take this medicine sooner. I use to get agitated about the smallest things. I was also always tired and I could sleep all day if allowed. I finally did some homework on this medicine and set a dr appointment. I take 20 mg and I am so grateful to have my Life back. It is worth a try.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Not bad for short term mental crutches, pretty good for long term regrets. It would have helped me decently had I not started dating 'the woman of my dreams' on month 2 of Lexapro this drug made me act as if I had the testosterone of a golden retriever. I couldn't comprehend intimacy. She jumped me once and it was as if she had stolen my virginity. -after being sexually active for a decade. I lost the ability to drive intimate momentum into a loving relationship. Not to mention the gas was outrageous. Probiotics were recommended, no change observed. However, I did poop blood if I ate very much red meat. It got worse if I had a drink with it. I took Lexapro for 10 months, I've been off of it for about 45 days now and haven't dropped blood in over a month. My libido is still recovering and I really hope that I regain the function that I had 12 months ago. Seems to be coming through, but I'm still bent by her leaving me.. she never met me, I feel barely introduced.

I have been taking Lexam for 6 months now. The first 2 weeks was the hardest. It is important to have a positive attitude towards this medication. 1 week includes nausea, headache and confusion, 2nd week I was desperate to cry to someone and had suicidal thoughts, 3rd week was quite by the 4th week the medication started showing improvement in my mood.  I was no longer crying, aimless, no more low mood, very active .The most important thing is I developed severe INSOMNIA, and it was hard to get sleep. Maximum of my sleep was 3 hours at night. I suffered sleepless nights but would be active in the morning. My doctor tried a few sedatives with me and nothing worked. A last resort was to let my body deal with it. so I get a full nights sleep every 4th night and other nights I sleep 2-3 hrs. But the Insomnia is worth as my mood is much better and no more negative thoughts of wanting to die.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I started this medication about 5 weeks ago and I have had a VERY noticeable change in my mood and much less anxiety. This medication has helped me get back to being me for the first time in many years and through various medications.

I have been on generic lexapro going on week 4 now. First week I noticed my anxiety was worst then before, second and 3 week got really bad nausea and headaches still experiencing it now going on week 4. Is this normal? Also I been having to pee a lot at night. I do feel my energy is back but also I been yawning like crazy and my stomachs gurgles.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Lexapro is one of the best anti-depressants available.  It takes about a month to kick in (you can read online about why these medicines take so long to work, it's complicated).  I'm on 20 mg, very few side effects, one being it takes longer to have an orgasm.  Overall, good medication.

I am a 36yr mother of 4, I have been on 20mg of escitapram for over 3 years and before that a whole other load of different meds!At first it were like a new lease of life I could actually leave the house..2 slow painful years of repeat prescriptions of it and I avoided all doctors apps (anxiety in me) avoided everything even taking my children to school. A family member stepped in an forced me to the doctors the doc gave me an add on of promezine 5ml morning and night still no change 2 week later.  I were very low by this point nothing would make me happy so went back an we were given another add on of trazadone 50mg and although I still have bouts of unhappiness the anxiety.  I am now managing my life and taking my kids to school. I believe it works with a balance of other drugs. 3 years later I am still on it and doctors haven’t even suggested coming off! I do wish I could be normal and not hold so many horrible thoughts/anxiety’s/memories and more!

Lexapro (escitalopram):This drug has saved my life! I started on 10mg and then got moved up to 20. I fortunately didn't have any side effects. I remember after my doctor suggested lexapro, I spent hours on this site reading reviews. I was nervous, but I'm so glad I decided to start lexapro. I had been experience anxiety and depression and lexapro has tremendously helped both. I didn't realize how bad my symptoms were until I got relief! I don't feel like I need to sleep all day now. Talking with people and making phone calls doesn't seem like a huge painful chore. I feel lighter and can motivate myself to get done what I have to. I also am in therapy which helps with some of my maladaptive thinking and negative self thoughts (those patterns won't go away overnight) I'm more equipped to challenge those thoughts on this medication. Sometimes my anxiety creeps back up for no reason and I've since been prescribed a PRN but overall I'm satisfied with my experience. I would recommend lexapro!

Lexapro (escitalopram):This medicine made my depression/anxiety worse. I'm 22 years old, and I was warned that people under 25 may have suicidal thoughts or worsening mood. My doctor prescribed me 10mg for depression/anxiety and insomnia. For the first 3 weeks, I didn't feel any change in mood and wasn't sleeping any better but thought I had to give it more time. Then the next 2 weeks were BAD. When I was driving I had thoughts like "If anyone were to crash into me right now I wouldn't care." And thoughts like that scared me! I went to my doctor yesterday and he switched me to Paxil. Please be careful if you are young and taking this drug.

I was on Cipralex for 6 years and it worked really well for me except a little off balance feeling. I tried to wean off with Doctors approval. I was off Cipralex for 4 months and then depression and anxiety came back. Cipralex didn’t work when I went back on it. Tried Pristiq but no luck. Now I have been on Zoloft. Hope and pray it works for me. If you are on any medication please try to stay on it and be happy with 8 or 9. Good luck!

Lexapro (escitalopram):I tried Lexapro for a month, it did work for my depression, I had hardly any side effects but this one: It made me lose my hair!! I went off of it immediately, I'm now trying to look for another antidepressant that does not make me lose hair

Have been on 10 mg of Escitalopram for a while have had bouts of depression over the last 20 years went on holiday got into bad sleeping and things escalated and I’m in another bout.  I  have been upped to 20mg been on it for a month am struggling with most things. I am still at work but it’s hard this is my 5th week should it start to kick in soon

I have tried this medicine a few times and I always have the same experience.  At the start up dose of 5mg I feel like I have a chance at feeling less hopeless. But I have terrible anxiety.  After an increase to 10mg in a fews weeks I am more depressed and anxious then when I started it. I have been on this medicine for 10 weeks and its like I'm screaming from a roller coaster to get off.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I have been on lexapro for around 9 months. I started on 10mg then went to 15mg (liquid version). It worked well to start off but then it started to not work as often. It made me gain 13kgs in the span of 7 months and for that side effect, the drug wasn't doing enough for me. I am now going to change to another medicine, maybe prozac and see how I go.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Lexapro was my miracle medication for a couple of years and all of sudden it stopped working. I had very little side effects, if any, and it gave me my life back. Years later, we tried Lexapro again with no relief from depression.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I currently take Lexapro 17.5mg for OCD/depression/anxiety. This drug has given me my life back. I was going off the deep end until I was prescribed this medication. I had some side effects to start off (trouble sleeping, weight gain), but have curbed these side effects through diet and exercise. Lexapro does a great job lifting depression and definitely helps with anxiety. I highly recommend this SSRI over Zoloft, which I was on for about 2 years. I also like the fact that the dosing of this med is much lower than that of Zoloft. Great experience with Lexapro. Helps with some of my anger too.

It all depends on the manufacture of the lexapro you are taking.  Some give you such horrific nightmares, some give you dreams that are confusing causing you anxiety you wake up short of breath and fuzzy.  Before the generic brands came out, this medicine was wonderful, no side effects and did it's job!  The pharmaceutical companys and our doctors should monitor what these generic meds do to their patients!

Take with major caution. If you experience any changes or decline in depressive mood contact your doctor immediately. My son committed suicide just after taking this medication for just a little over 2 weeks. He was 21 years old. It changed him in just that brief amount of time. Take with caution. Observe behavior changes. Don't hesitate to call on call services or go to ER. I know it works well for many people but just a warning to pay attention to. People need to know this

I was prescribed this medication by my doctor a little more than a month ago for my depression which has been impairing my life for about a year. It just started getting worse and was no longer a thing I could push away.
